review.reviewBody: If you want a simple sneaker that will hold its own at the gym or as your daily go-to, this is a great option to consider.

review.reviewBody: Great for a wide variety of scenarios from casual walking to training
review.name: Super comfy!

review.reviewBody: Great light shoe. Size 14. One minor critique are my toes seem to hit the top of the shoe and for a split second get caught in the material at the top of the shoe.
review.name: Great shoe

review.reviewBody: These Solimar shoes are replacements to Hoka Arahi 7's I had purchased which came apart in less than six months. The Solimar style to me, is a lot more comfortable than Arahis straight out of the box. The Arahis had to be broken in.
review.name: Solimar- So far so good

review.reviewBody: Absolutely love this style of shoe! I have had the Clifton's before and wanted to branch out and see what other styles work best for me and this style is phenomenal!
review.name: Solimar shoes

review.reviewBody: On time was very pleased with over all transaction. Quality of shoe is just as expected, haven't been disappointed yet.
review.name: Solimar

review.reviewBody: Use the shoe for short distance walking. Good looking shoe but not supportive for distance walking. Will purchase same look walking/running shoe.
review.name: I would buy this shoe again for casual ware.

review.reviewBody: this is my 6th pair - not because of quality, rather i appreciate variety. all 6 pairs are still going strong and my feet appreciate you. podiatrist doesn't want to see me for a year. i must say, my oldest pair of Cliftons are showing above average wear inside the heel. soles and all other parts are holding up nicely
review.name: satisfied customer

review.reviewBody: Most of my body is arthritic, especially my feet, and I cannot do much standing or walking. I recently noticed both a doctor and a nurse wearing HOKAs and I asked them why. I was told how comfortable they are for folks who have to spend a good part of their day on their feet. So I bit the bullet and paid a fair amount of money for a pair of HOKAs. I've only worn them a couple of days, but they live up to their rep for comfort. Glad to have them.
review.name: extremely comfortable shoes--glad to have them

review.reviewBody: Looks like this dosent have good ankle support. My right ankle pains everytime i walk. This was promoted as a walking shoe. Really disappointed. Bondi was great and will probably go back to it.
review.name: I wont buy this again

review.reviewBody: I was excited to try this after a long day of cold, rainy hiking in Alaska, but alas I was a bit underwhelmed.  Overall texture was decent and it was certainly filling thanks to the abundance of rice, but the flavor was a bit "thin" IMO, ie: it tastes like salty, spicy water with rice and okra.
review.name: Good, not great

review.reviewBody: I ate the entire bag of gumbo at the end of a long hike in the rain under my tent vestibule, and it revitalized and re-energized me immediately with its aroma, texture, and flavor. I annoyed my hiking party by constantly commenting on how good the gumbo was last night! It makes a very large portion and is great for sharing. It?s pricey, but it is a great value for making a warm, filling meal at the end of a long day for two people.
review.name: So delicious!

name: Chicken Gumbo - 2 Servings

review.itemreviewed: Light Hiker Jr Micro Crew Light Cushion Hiking Sock - Boys'
review.reviewBody: I love Darn Tough socks of all sorts. High quality, great feel, supports industry and production in the US, and they hold up wonderfully. I'm a field scientist who has experimented with many brands of so-called high quality socks, and Darn Tough is the best. After buying several pairs in Adult Women's Medium sock size, I tried Junior Large to see if it works with my feet. (The Juniors are often significantly cheaper than the Adult socks.) It works great! My woman's shoe size is 7.5 (US) or 39 (EU), and my feet are slightly wider than normal. So if you are around this size, you too may find that Juniors work for you! ALSO, more information on this particular sock: It has a very modest cushioning effect. Not bulky. Good, uniform feel about the foot. Great for people who want some warmth/cushion without bulk.
review.name: Junior Large fits women up to size 7.5

name: Light Hiker Jr Micro Crew Light Cushion Hiking Sock - Boys'

review.reviewBody: Good service, easy to order and arrived as specified. These are a Xmas present so have not been worn yet but the look very good
review.name: Look good

review.reviewBody:
I purchased my pair of Caribous in the late 1980’s and I’m still using them almost 40 years later!  I finally had to purchase a new set of liners last year, and they fit perfectly.

I’ve been through many a winter in both Montana and Alaska, through wet snow and dry, through temperatures into -40 and never had a problem with my feet staying warm.

I consider this pair of boots to be one of the best purchases I have ever made.  All hail Sorel!
review.name: The Best, period.

review.reviewBody: Way too heavy and wide.  Tried sizing down but they’re so short that my toes hit the end of the boot on a half size down.  Regret exchanging them for TTS, wish I had just returned them.
review.name: Bad sizing/width
comment: Hello Aw, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our CARIBOU™ Men's Waterproof Boot is hard to size. We’re happy to help assist with the issue if you will reach out to our Customer Care team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: Keep my usually cold feet warm.  Keeps my feet dry also! This is my fifth pair on 30 years. Definitely worth it!
review.name: Love them!❤️

review.reviewBody: Been trying for 3 years to find warm comfy boots. These are the ticket. Absolutely love these boots. A++++
review.name: Warm feet for once!

review.reviewBody: Very easy process to order and receive my new boots. Usually don’t order online.  Thanks
review.name: Sorel boots

review.reviewBody: Great quality, well built, perfect for tromping around in snow.  I wear them when I use my snowblower.  Great traction, comfy warm.   Five stars
review.name: Sorel Caribou Snow Boots -THUMBS UP

review.reviewBody: Best rugged, comfort designed boot I've ever worn. I may be able to postpone both ankle joint replacements indefinitely.
review.name: Comfort designed boot.

review.reviewBody: These are very warm but almost impossible to walk in.  The sizing is very weird, half size down and my toes were up against the front of the boot, my brannock size they feel about 4 widths too wide.
review.name: Warm but extremely uncomfortable

name: Caribou Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: My recent trip to Ireland and Scotland was made even better with the Inquire Chukka Hiking Boots. These boots are incredibly comfortable, offer excellent traction, and their stylish design fits outdoor adventures and casual wear. They're durable, too, showing no signs of wear and tear, and comfortable day after day.  I highly recommend these boots for any traveler or hiker. They provide comfort, stability, and reliability for your journeys. Make them your go-to footwear for your next adventure – you won't be disappointed!
review.name: Sure-Footed Comfort

review.reviewBody: These are amazing hiking boots. I used them for a backpacking trip to Europe brand new out of the box and had no issues with blistering or pain. They are light making them great to travel with and also grippy so there is no skidding around in them.  You can even dress up or down. Worth every penny.
review.name: No breaking in required.

review.reviewBody: First hike was 5 miles. They?re very comfortable out of the box. Love them.
review.name: Comf

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and lightweight!
review.name: Love them!

review.reviewBody: These boots are comfy right out of the box.  I purchased a 7.5 my normal shoe size due to reviewers saying this brand ran a little large.  I wear an 8 in running sneakers so I was a bit hesitant but these fit like a charm.  Enough room in toe box.  Super cushion and support in the footbed.  Nice taupe color.  You really could wear these around town they have a nice stylish look.  Mostly for easy trails.  I also got a pair of the 600 brown suede which Is a bit more hefty for snow/stronger woodland hiking.  Very pleased!
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody: These boots are so cute!!!. They hurt my feet with low socks so make sure to wear nice comfy hiking socks. They are great in the field and super cute I got so many compliments ??
review.name: Love everything about these boots!

name: Inquire Chukka Hiking Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: Just the right size with good pockets and features for everyday use going to work. Has all the right pockets for laptop and peripherals and plenty of leftover room for my lunch, while maintaining a nice compact size.
review.name: Perfect Everyday Work bag

review.reviewBody:
I use this bag for everyday IT work.

It will fit a Macbook Pro 16in but it's a tighter fit (which I prefer). The main compartment can fit up to 4 laptops but you need to be careful with how you handle the bag as there isn't much bottom padding protection outside of the main laptop sleeve. (I'm definitely using the bag outside of its means). 

This slim profile backpack is amazing and hits everything I care about in an everyday carry bag. It isn't very light but it's extremely durable, well designed, and is extremely comfortable.

2 minor issues that doesn't bother me too much (based off my rating) was:
1.) the water bottle does hold a Nalegene (which is what I typically carry) but other style water bottles will be a bit loose and may fall out.
2.) The "sunglasses pocket" is too shallow. I primarily only use it for charging cables and dongles. There is a lot of supplemental pockets to hold a more traditional sunglasses case.

Great backpack and worth the price in my opinion.
review.name: Comfortable Everyday Bag! Fits Mbp 16in!!

review.reviewBody: Mystery Ranch never disappoints and this bag is great for day to day use.
review.name: High quality

review.reviewBody: The district 18 has been my daily carry for the last month of a resident masters program. I carry a laptop, mouse, charger, notebook, etc. Every day and it still looks like it did out of the box. Stitching and materials seem to be quality and it feels comfortable. The only thing I can't fit into it is my lunchbox. 10/10 would take to the county fair; 3/10 would take to war.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: Recently bought this to be my work backpack (office job with bike commute), and used it as my personal item on a long overseas flight. It's also been good as a small day pack for outdoor climbing. The pockets are great for keeping my things organized and it fits comfortably, plus the water bottle holders are perfect for Nalgenes/similar. It holds about the right amount of stuff for work/travel/short day trips, but would probably be a little small for a bigger day hike (and has no hip strap). Overall so far it's been absolutely fantastic for everything I wanted to use it for! Only flaw is the velcro on the front, I wish it was magnets or snaps or even just a blank flap instead.
review.name: All around fabulous

review.reviewBody:
First, as always, top quality build. 
Second,  many bags/packs marketed for school are huge - not so for the District 18 - the volume is just right for the essentials need for class
Third, the design allowing to open like a folder (and yet not have stuff spill out) prevents items from being lost at the bottom of the bag. 
Forth, unlike other dark interior bags, the bright orange allows for easy viewing of items inside the pack.
review.name: Perfect book bag for college

review.reviewBody: Good buy, will last for a long time. Pack is a solid build nothing, new from Mystery Ranch but I do have some small nitpicky issues, but none of them are keeping me from using it everyday. I switched from a pack with more organization slots so I had to group most of my smaller items in little pouches that fit perfectly in the slots provided inside and re-organize. Once i got over this i've had no issues. Great bag, recommend.
review.name: Worth it

review.reviewBody:
Backpack has a basis but it just has a general feeling that it was designed until someone ran out of time. Bottom line: I should have not have convinced myself that it would work for me and should have returned immediately.  I look forward to future revisions. 

Pros:
**Feels good on the back. 
**I like the interior organization of the main compartment. Several open pockets that allow for relative ease of use. 
**I came to appreciate the hybrid half-zip/clam shell design of the main pocket. There are interior flaps that prevent the bag from opening completely but can be undone to allow a clam shell opening.

Cons:
**Front pocket is underdeveloped.  No admin pouch which I thought would not be an issue but quickly became one of my main irritants. No mesh pockets or pen holders. It does barely fit a Steam Deck and generic charger
**Top pouch is extremely shallow to the point of being virtually useless. Not felt lined.
**Laptop compartment is not suspended from the bottom
**No strap keepers. Just an odd omission
**Water bottle holders are technically made of a stretchy material but are unable to keep anything but the largest bottles in place.
review.name: A good but incomplete EDC backpack

review.reviewBody: This is a great pack to replace a briefcase or computer bag.  My computer fits in it well, plus there is a ton of pockets for organizing all the rest of the junk I need to take with it.  Plenty of room for cords and drives and truck keys and lunch and everything else plus it's comfortable to carry.
review.name: So much better than a briefcase

review.reviewBody:
I have been using this for three weeks and it is great. The interior is white _ outside blue if you care _ the white makes it so easy to find things. My old black pack made it easy to loose things inside.
The quality was top notcha s alwways.
review.name: Well made

name: District 18L Backpack

review.reviewBody: Fit perfectly! These don’t slip off (without a heel backing) and I love them as slippers!
review.name: Comfy cozy slippers

review.reviewBody: I am on my second pair of these slippers after my first pair lasted 2 years. I cannot express how comfortable, warm and durable they are. No other skipper will have my heart again.
review.name: Best of the best!

review.reviewBody: Love these slippers! I wear a 5 1/2 or 6 but got these in a size 5 in  Bloodstone. They are so comfy.. Best slippers I've ever owned.
review.name: Best Slippers Ever!

review.reviewBody: Extremely warm and cozy. It took a few days to mold to my feet, but now they are perfect.
review.name: Coffee Run Slippers

review.reviewBody: These are the best slippers i have ever had. I love them so much. My feet feel like they are being spoiled when i slip them on.
review.name: Favorite slippers EVER!

review.reviewBody: I was skeptical that these size 10 would fit...the 9's were too small.  But these 10's are great.  I receive a foot hug every time I slip on my slippers
review.name: Hug for my feet

review.reviewBody: Love the slippers. They are so comfortable and warm.
review.name: Great slippers

review.reviewBody: i have owned these slippers almost 8 months and it is still shedding.  I own the black color.  It's like a black bear has invaded our house.  Never again.  I will stick to LL Beans
review.name: Horrible
comment: In early days of wear you may experience some light shedding of excess fibers. This is a natural byproduct of the material application through the manufacturing process. This will subside quickly and does not affect product aesthetics, fit or longevity.

review.reviewBody: Love love love these. Worth the hefty price tag for a pair of slippers. The sole is super durable and great for running errands when it’s chilly out and you want to stay comfy and cozy.
review.name: Buy Them!

review.reviewBody: Great… like walking on clouds!  I could wear them to bed or on a mountain hike!  A super shoe!  Indoors or outdoors they feel like wings on my feet!   Just had foot surgery and they are better than any pill!  On a par with the prior best shoe of all time- the moccasin!
review.name: The most comfortable shoes I’ve ever worn!

description: Buy the Black Diamond Solution Honnold Edition Harness - Men's online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Solution Honnold Edition Harness - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Solution Honnold Edition Harness - Men's online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: One of the most comfortable harnesses I have ever worn and the gear loops are an amazing shape. Plus it’s light and a cool color. Even goes towards charity too! What’s not to like!
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody: i bought this for my boyfriend who is an avid rock climber and he said it’s the best harness he’s used. absolutely great for beginners and professionals!
review.name: amazing!

review.reviewBody: My son began climbing three months ago after feeling out of place with traditional ball sports. He has found something special. After I found him watching free solo on his own, I thought that this harness would inspire him further. It fits him perfect , and I have always trusted BD to keep me safe. Mission accomplished!
review.name: Inspiration for the next generation

review.reviewBody: Got this for my husband who's just getting back into climbing and he loves it! Super comfy and definitely and upgrade from his previous harness. Fits him really well. Psyched!
review.name: Great harness

review.reviewBody: I like the comfort of the solution...feels like a sturdy harness but it pretty light. Watch the sizing...you want to get it right, so that the gear loops are in the right position. Though I fit a Medium (I'm a 33 waist), the Large is better in terms of where the gear loops sit. Some day hopefully, BD will figure out how to make the straps at the back more robust...they are always the first thing that fails.
review.name: Great trad and all-around

review.reviewBody: perfect addition to the arsenal easy to navigate on the initial outing on the 7 pitches of SEWS in the north cascades. medium fits a bit on the tighter side for me with a 33waist, but still works
review.name: solution indeed

review.reviewBody:
Fits and feels great! 
I like the elastic stretch on the legs versus.
review.name: Harness

review.reviewBody: Quality feels top notch and the cause is extremely worthy. Leg loops are very comfortable and it’s nice that they auto tighten. I highly recommend this harness.
review.name: Excellent Harness

review.reviewBody: This harness is lightweight but comfortable. Adequate padding and width. Great harness for moderately skilled climbers to graduate from beginner harnesses. Gear loops are easy to clip in, leg loops adjust to your legs due to the elastic band. It’s not constricting to wear and I love the color. The elastic band takes a beating when you rig up a third hand to a leg loop( I wouldn’t recommend doing that) overall this harness is great for sport climbing. I’m not sure if a small percentage of the proceeds go to the Honnold Foundation after purchase but, if it is, It’s for a good cause.
review.name: Great choice for a lightweight comfortable harness

review.reviewBody:
Great harness, 
My only complaint is the leg loops are a little small. Need to go up a size if you have muscular or larger legs.
review.name: Great harness

name: Solution Honnold Edition Harness - Men's

review.reviewBody: Loved the boot but was too large for my needs! I am typically a 10.5 so eventually would hope for half sizes. Instead I ordered the Classic in a size 10, hopeful that it will workout for me.
review.name: Great style, too large

review.reviewBody: Love these boots, they easily slip on and off for farm chores, and are perfectly comfortable!
review.name: Perfect chore boot

review.reviewBody: I bought these for my husband, and he really likes these boots
review.name: Good boot

review.reviewBody: This is my fifth pair of Boggs that I have bought. I think they're great. This Digger Mid is perfect for my needs. I'll use them at the farm and I like the slip on and off. Very comfortable. I'll continue to buy Boggs
review.name: Ideal for the farm. Easy on easy off

review.reviewBody: love these boots. look good, feel good and do the job. highly recommend
review.name: cool boots for the rain and heat

review.reviewBody: Finally after 2 returns to get the correct size, am extremely happy. Comfortable, perfect all weather shoe as I am a part-time postal carrier. On my feet for seven hours a day and they have survived all weather conditions tested so far. Great value.
review.name: Comfortable stylish and durable

review.reviewBody: I use these almost every day, great for yard work. These are so comfortable, my foot slips right in and out .
review.name: Great boots

review.reviewBody: The digger mid height boot was one of the most comfortable boots I have ever worn. I am usually a 11 - 11.5 US, and purchased a size 12 because of reviews. The reviews were spot on, and with a regular pair of boot socks, the fit is perfect! I haven't had them long enough to rate this boots durability.
review.name: Bogs Digger mid boot, a solid 10

review.reviewBody: Roomy comfy boot, could use a thicker insole though. I put one in and now it's perfect
review.name: roomy

review.reviewBody: These boots are great for working in the yard...the 1st week I used them to pour concrete in my driveway..I thought the concrete was going to overflow back in my boots but these worked out fine...cleaned up my boots with the hose...these are great boots...feet are dry and happy
review.name: Dry feet

review.itemreviewed: Kanibou WP Hiking Boot - Little Kids'
review.reviewBody: We love these boots! We got our first pairs two years ago and they are holding up great with over 100 days on each pair so far. We live in the PNW with lots of snow, rain, and mud. Outside of tromping through creeks the waterproofness holds up great. We still have rain boots for puddle jumping but for general hiking and keeping warm in the snow with some soggy bits in between these have been great! Our littlest pair have held up well enough we expect to be able to pass them down to a third user with no troubles.
review.name: Great Hike/Snow/Generalized Tromping Boot

review.itemreviewed: Kanibou WP Hiking Boot - Little Kids'
review.reviewBody: Comfortable, warm and easy to walk in. Qualities you expect in an adult boot but often don't see in boots for little ones
review.name: Great boot

review.reviewBody: I've taken these skiing and snowshoeing in Canada.  I love that I was able to find a size small tall in a color other than black (not sure if that's still the case, but please keep making tall sizes in fun colors, Outdoor Research). Love the drop seat - no problem using the facilities while in the backcountry. Light weight, nice amount of stretch. Love the beacon pocket and front pocket where I put my phone. Very glad for the scuff guards on the bottom of the pant legs - I would have shredded the inside cuff very quickly with both my ski and snowshoe edges. I'm 5'9", 145lbs with long legs, not much for hips, and 29" poorly defined waist (ruler shaped) and I wear a small tall with comfortable room for a thin base layer bottoms, but I'm definitely at the end range for that size.
review.name: Great Features for the Tall Ladies

review.reviewBody: Actually love these! I’m 6’ tall and 175lbs so having a tall size option is amazing. These are long enough and fit just right! (Large Tall)
review.name: Can’t wait to use this ski season!

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of these and I love them. I am especially stoked that they make a short version which is the best for me!
review.name: Great backcountry skiing bib

review.reviewBody: I think outdoor research is the only company where gear is actually true to size. I'm regularly a medium in street clothes but feel have to size up in ski gear for complete range of motion, particularly in hip and thighs (And I'm pretty straight up and down). These mediums fit with room for base layers and movement. Tons of pockets and easy to vent. No snow down the back side either when I inevitably fall! I love love LOVE the tall length (I'm 5'11"). Very happy with these!
review.name: Tall lady approved!

review.reviewBody: Too thin thus making it feel cheap for the price
review.name: Too thin but appreciate the petite sizing

review.reviewBody: Thank you Outdoor Research for making tall bibs! If you could offer more Tall sizes that would be even better! At 5'11 it has always been a struggle to find pants that fit! These are amazing!
review.name: Amazing for Tall Women

review.reviewBody: Have worn the bibs a couple times now - they feel great, work great. Haven't been backcountry yet but I think they'll be awesome. Only 4 stars because I think the fit is slightly weird on me right above the side vents.
review.name: Great pants overall

review.reviewBody: Tried it yesterday for the first time in a big snow storm (Québec). Temperature-20 with the wind. Went to do touring. I am very happy i got them. Waterproof, good sizing (large, im 5,2 165 lbs), confortable with layers under. Thanks
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: Not sure what took me so long to switch to bibs for backcountry skiing. I think my greatest fear was how hard it would be to pee in them. Well, I find it easier than with pants! I tried it out at home to see what it required. The key is to pull the zipper all the way down. The improvements are you just pull the bibs across your bum and squat and there are no pants bunched up below and no peeing in your pants (yes, that has happened.) And it doesn't require a major squat to have them out of the way. Then, bonus two, when you are done and you stand up to zip up the bibs, your butt is covered, your front is covered, and you can casually pull up your undies! Just blown away at the improvement from pants. I love also that I can layer a couple pairs of long undies and have no constricting waistband. These bibs are thin but easy to layer. Love having my iPhone in that chest pocket. The only downside of the Carbide bibs is that they are too long by about three inches (I got a size large, 31.5 inseam which is my inseam) but I just roll them up when I take off my ski boots. Also the hand pockets are too deep and my beacon just sags low on my thigh which is a tad uncomfortable which is why I couldn't give them a five star rating. But wow, I'm a convert. Love the Carbide Bibs!
review.name: I love 'em

review.reviewBody: I was very excited to receive my purchase (I bought the bibs and matching jacket) until I noticed the sewing of the shoulder straps is very uneven. The right shoulder strap is sewn in a few centimeters further in than the other, resulting in an uneven fit. I reached out to customer service only to be told there is nothing they can do about the defective item they shipped me, and I can only return it. I am disappointed with the quality of the bibs and the lack support received from customer service regarding an issue out of my control. Hopefully this is a one-off and does not happen to others ordering from OR!
review.name: Defective and Disappointed

name: Carbide Bib Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: I upgraded my NX to this X01 12 speed drivetrain with the new 52t cassette. What a difference the X01 shifter makes with this derailleur! Shifts are crisp and there is so hunting for gears in the middle of the cassette. The red is a fun color addition, but know that the piece that connects to the derailleur hanger is silver not a dark grey like it appears in photos. I recommend the X01 so far though I haven’t taken it on more than 1 ride so far. It is a significant upgrade from the NX lineup.
review.name: Crisp shifting

review.reviewBody: I have ridden where twigs not a part of the daily ride due to the lack of twigs and have not had a problem with twigs clogging up and derailing my ride!  Shout out to Twiggie and Twiggy Saders!
review.name: No twigs here!

review.reviewBody: Really love the versatility of this jacket. It is a high quality garment..
review.name: Really love the versatility of

review.reviewBody: Purchased this for my husband in men's XL, and he thought I purchased a women's coat because the zipper was reversed.  He immediately gave it a thumbs down - didn't think he could get used to the zipper on that side.  Otherwise it fit nicely and true to size.  Weird. Bummer.
review.name: Zipper for men's raincoat on wrong side

review.reviewBody: I originally purchased v1.0 when it first came out to great reviews. I found the zipper unworkable and sticky. Version 2.0 is better, the zipper is large and works well. I like the flexible and stashable nature of this highly water resistant jacket. 5'11", 180 lbs, 40" chest, 35" waist. Large fits well for me, without being form fitting.
review.name: 2.0 improved

review.reviewBody: My first test of this jacket was when i had to go out in a sudden heavy rain that was filling up the awning on our 13' SCAMP trailer. I lowered one corner and was immediately doused with a  huge amount of water, none of which penetrated the jacket.  very pleased.  I regularly wear it when doing morning dog walk and it works well as a light wind breaker.
review.name: very water proof

review.reviewBody: A great piece of kit: light, waterproof and fits well.
review.name: A great piece of kit:

review.reviewBody: I’m a mountain guide and have been wearing shell jackets for over 50 years and this jacket is the best (and one of the most inexpensive) I’ve used. Because of the stretchiness of the material one can have a closer fit than with a conventional shell. Initially, I bought it too big and sent it back for a smaller size. I’ve used it in summer and for all my ski touring this winter, always with a rucksack and have no bobbling or signs of wear so I think that others who have this problem must have abrasive rucksack straps. Even with lots of layers underneath, including a duvet, it is still comfortable. Its lightness and packability are good for space in rucksack. I like the lack of rustling and flexibility. Hood is comfortable and spacious. It could do with an adjustment at the back of the hood to raise the peak for better visibility. Pockets are generous and work when wearing a harness and rucksack. It will be interesting to see how long it can continue to perform and see whether it can outlast goretex garments.
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: A good jacket but not a great one. It needs to be zipped up to the neck but when you do it takes a while or even longer getting used to so initially uncomfortable but give it a while and your persistence will be rewarded.
review.name: A good jacket but not

review.reviewBody: Cant take mine of, just works whatever the weather.
review.name: Fantastic all rounder!

review.reviewBody: Well made. Lightweight but still warm and windproof. Bought large to allow layering...but have worn with just T shirt as not too bulky. Sleeves great with velcro fastening. Colour I would say as shown.
review.name: Well made. Lightweight but still

review.reviewBody:
A massive thumbs up from me.
I bought 2 months ago and only got to wear today in the rain. Does exactly what it’s meant to, kept me dry. I’m in a wheelchair now but still use Rab like I did when in the mountains. Just ordered the same in the pant today.
review.name: Thumbs up from me

name: Kinetic 2.0 Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: Extremely comfortable, durable and easy to customize the way you use it and/or want it to look. I use size 7 on flatforms which resulted in the same size for these.
review.name: Totally worth it!

review.reviewBody: I bought these to wear hiking and walking around cities in Iceland. The first day I wore them, I got huge blisters on both feet. They are also not waterproof at all. What a waste of money.
review.name: Ruined my vacation

review.reviewBody: I ordered a 9.5. I normally wear a 10. These fit perfectly!!! They're so well made. They're beautiful. I just can't say enough about these gorgeous boots.
review.name: LOVE THESE BOOTS!!!

review.reviewBody: Aesthetically I really loved how these boots looked! I didn't mind the olive green color (something different than black or brown neutrals). As much as I didn't want to deal with laces, I would've been ok to take the extra time to lace up. The reason I had to return these even on a great half off deal, is that it hurts to walk in! Very rigid on my shins every time I took a step. Maybe I had to break them in more-I actually never wore them outside. I tried to just break them in a little indoors. But upon much deliberation, I had to return. It didn't fit like a glove, and not comfy right off the bat as my current Teva De La Vina boots were that I've had for 7 years, but sadly have worn out! Customer service was fantastic in that someone helped me out via phone call and helped set up the prepaid shipping label for me. I received the refund super quick as well! I wish Teva to make more casual boot options without laces! I love Teva!
review.name: I really wanted to keep these and make them work!

review.reviewBody: I bought these boots for my daughter. She loves them. I love the look and feel of the boots. I am going by purchase myself a pair also. They are extremely comfortable and are of great quality.
review.name: I will be buying another pair!

review.reviewBody: I wasn't expecting these to look so tailored. I anticipated more bulky and a work boot look. I had concerns. I won the jackpot with these boots, super functional, climbing up a steep, red clay, slope, while looking like a regular fashion boot. I have fibromyalgia and the weight of these, and insole, are awesome! Light enough, comfy, and great ankle support. You could wear these functional or fashion.
review.name: Cute Functional Waterproof Boots

review.reviewBody: I was really excited about these because I loved the color and design. But I've been generally unimpressed. They took a lot longer to break in than other leather boots I've had. In just the first month I had to wax the threads on the exterior seams because they were already starting to come undone. The threads are just too thin and fray easily. But the real issue is the back section behind the ball of the foot. While the front half has triple sewed seams, the back only is single sewed! Now, it appears like the back has two seams. But after the first seam came undone, it revealed that the second stich wasn't attached to the top piece! Now, I'm pretty annoyed that the stitch came undone. I've only had these about nine months, and I only use them in light duty applications. I don't use these to hike or work; just for regular walking around. I treat my shoes with a lot of respect, so I was shocked that these failed after less than a year! These don't even hold up to light daily use; they would not take any sort of actual boot use.
review.name: Back half poorly designed

review.reviewBody: I love boots, good quality leather boots. I was looking for a boot that could do it all, from dressing up with a cute dress to going out to kicking around town in joggers to hiking and rain. These boots fit the bill! Much lighter and less clunky than my Docs. Easy side zip!!! And with several wears now, the leather is breaking in really nicely! I have wide feet, usually wear barefoot style shoes, and these have room in the toe box and the leather is adapting to my foot. Fit true to size. Love them for traveling because they're so versatile, so I just need these boots and a sandal for my whole trip. They've excelled in Texas, Colorado, California, and Costa Rica so far! Highly recommended, just remember to wear them and break them in before doing a high-mileage jaunt. I put moleskin patches on my heels the first 2 or 3 wears, and now they're good and I don't need the patches anymore.
review.name: Love this boot!!!

review.reviewBody: As a plus size person whose feet tend to retain water, it is very hard to find a good quality pair of hiking boots. Especially ones that go past the ankle. I want to thank everybody here that left the review saying stay true to your size and let them break in... Instead of sizing up. When I first put them on I was panicked, and thought I would have to return them. I had to widen the laces and let the middle part show more than it is in the picture. (But that also leaves a lot of room for adjustment and comfortability.) Seriously, Let. Them. Break. In. It took me about 4 days to break them in. And it's been about 2 weeks where I can just slide them on and walk like it's nothing. They are the most supportive, comfortable, well designed, and flexible boots I've ever owned. I usually have to buy a wide boot but they are just wide enough. Wearing these boots in the garden, for nature walks, and even just to run errands, actually helps the swelling in my feet. They do show scuffs and marks easy but those usually fade and honestly they just look like a really nice well-worn hiking boot.. I don't have any issue with the aesthetic I'm going for comfortable, durable, and practical. I'm so happy with these boots that I'd like to buy another but maybe save up for a different color. I personally can't recommend these enough, for all sizes but especially anyone who's plus size that really wants to go on hikes in the woods lol. Thank you Teva team, you set a high standard ☺️
review.name: Plus sized and relieved, they're perfect

review.reviewBody: These fit perfectly. Instantly comfortable and very well made. I love that they are waterproof but still look dressy, and can be used hiking. Perfect for travel if you don't want to bring a lot of different types of shoes. The color is awesome too.
review.name: Love these boots!

name: Rowena Lace Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: Love the boots. Quick lace system is super convenient and they don’t loosen throughout the day. If you’re looking for support and responsiveness, the boots have them in spades. My only qualm is due to the design of the quick laces, the top portion of the boot doesn’t tighten as much as I would like. The lace system tightens the loop closest to the ankle first and by the time that tension has been wrapped in and out the boot a couple times and reaches the top, there’s not much left. The result is you end up getting a little play up high before your shin gets the boots to respond. The support is still really good, and once that shin hits, the boots respond. Wonder if burtons thought about adding one of those Velcro shin straps that deeluxe has been putting on their boots. Thinking of figuring one out myself. Anywho, good luck and happy hunting on the dreadful snowboard boot finding pilgrimage. 4.5/5 final rating
review.name: Great boots. Almost perfect

review.reviewBody: They do seem stiffer than my previous pair and I also had to go up a 1/2 size. No BOA to break, bomber boots.
review.name: Stiffer than previous

review.reviewBody:
Amazing how comfortable these boots are right out of the box, it’s got a bit more lateral stiffness than I thought- exactly what I wanted. Test run tomorrow.

Shipped and to me ridiculously fast- to Maryland in three days!

Thank you
Snozzelfondu
review.name: Spot on!

review.reviewBody: These goggles look cool and like the color but the anti-fog thing is not accurate at all. My cheap pair from Costco fogged up less than these. I stop at a hand dryer at least twice a day to de-fog them. When they’re not fogged up, they’re great in high light conditions. They’re not the best at low light conditions but better than I expected. I’d steer clear and find ones where the anti-fog actually works.

review.reviewBody: I compete often in Gran Fondos. Fantastic bar tape!
review.name: Fantastic Bar Tape!

review.reviewBody: The cheapest and easiest way to improve your ride is new bar tape. I have tried a lot of different tapes and always end up returning to Lizard Skin 3.2. This tape has good cushion but still allows a good feel on the bars while out of the saddle or while leaning into a corner. I like the fact that I can take it off and wash it and re-apply a couple of times during the season to get rid of the grime that builds up. Regardless, I still replace every spring and love the look and feel of new Lizard skin bar tape.
review.name: New tape, New bike feel

review.reviewBody: I love the thick, cushioned feel and grippy texture of this bar tape. It's a little more difficult to apply because of its thickness but well worth it in terms of feel. It's cushy and really helps reduce road vibration in my hands and arms. It has been on my bike for over a year. I ride every day and have done several longer rides (50+ miles) and it is still in great condition.
review.name: Great bar tape

review.reviewBody: This tape seemed good at first, but within weeks it was destroyed. It gets very dirty and fell apart. Unless you are in the tour and are re taping your bars every ride, I would avoid this stuff
review.name: Got destroyed after a few hundered miles

review.reviewBody: Held off on ordering for quite a while due to cost, finally but the bullet and I wish I had earlier. Installed on my gravel bike, this bar tape is grippy when wet and dry and the added cushioning it great without groves.
review.name: Now I see what the hype is about

review.reviewBody:
Fat... Fat Fat....    There are cushy for sure, but the tape on the underside is minimal and should be wider to stick better.    I feel like im using the old sponge type handle bar foam...  

They are comfy for sure, but because its fat, they are moving already and spreading out and i will have to re-wrap them again.
review.name: Lizard shins dsp 3.2mm

review.reviewBody: Lizard skin is the only bar tape I use. When your riding 4,000 plus miles a summer you?ll appreciate the thickness.  They are very grip for bar tape too. If your looking for comfort and quality, look no further.
review.name: Very soft

review.reviewBody: I bought this bar tape because of the popularity thinking I would get great service out of it, wrong! After installing about two weeks the tape is already showing dirt easily, my tape is the dark blue color. I definitely won?t be buying this tape again.
review.name: Gets dirty really easily
comment: I second Lynn's comment. Clean with alcohol and you'll be good. Keeps it clean and maintains that tactile grip. I've been running strictly the 3.2mm tape for about 6 years across 8 bikes without issue.
the instructions say to clean it with Alcohol.  The tape does get dirty but any brand of tape I have used gets dirty. I have had Lizard Skins on my bikes for years and had really good results.

name: DSP 3.2mm Bar Tape

description: Buy the Thule T2 Pro XT - 2 Bike Hitch Rack Add On online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: T2 Pro XT - 2 Bike Hitch Rack Add On
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule T2 Pro XT - 2 Bike Hitch Rack Add On online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: T2 Pro XT - 2 Bike Hitch Rack Add On
review.reviewBody:
This extension is horrible and I struggle every time I use it.  It's heavy and hard to carry, but that's fine.  I'll assume that makes it more sturdy.  But there are 2 big issues.  The first is with attaching it.  You have to line it up just right so it connects to the handle.  This seems to get harder every time I attach it and it usually takes me over an hour to actually get it connected.  The 2nd big issue is that even when that's connected, it doesn't work right.  The handle feels like it jams and won't lift.  If my car is facing downhill it never works.  If the car is facing uphill or on flat ground it works sometimes.  If it doesn't work, I have to get a wrench and help guide it from the inside.  There are lots complaints about this if you look on any reviews.  You may be lucky and have your be fine.  It seems about 3 out of 4 of them are okay.  

I've had this rack 3 years now and only use it 2-3 times a year.  It's not as if it's old.  These are just issue due to poor design or manufacturing.  I'll also note that I had the older version of this rack about 15 years ago and it worked great.  But they seem to have complicated things with this design and there are now common issues with it.
review.name: I'll Never Buy a Thule Rack Again

review.itemreviewed: T2 Pro XT - 2 Bike Hitch Rack Add On
review.reviewBody: I bought this extension to help move 4 bikes across the country. It was easy to install and works great as expected. With the extension, the total rake height is quite high when vertical but I have not noticed a major hit to the mpg; and it is notably heavy. That said, it’s very sturdy and should hold up for years.
review.name: Classic Thule

review.itemreviewed: T2 Pro XT - 2 Bike Hitch Rack Add On
review.reviewBody: I have the Thule T-2 Pro XTR. Love it. Works great with my carbon fiber frames. Bought the add on when we have extra bikes to bring with us.
review.name: Great product!

review.itemreviewed: T2 Pro XT - 2 Bike Hitch Rack Add On
review.reviewBody: Got a two bike and 2 bike extention kit a few years ago. Included illustrated instructions were very poor, had to rely on non-thule reviews to understand what thule was trying to show.. Rack functions on edge of performance window for two bikes, but with 2 bike extension, as reported in another review "the handle doesn't work, even when connected correctly. I can use the handle to move the lock latch a bit, but not enough to toggle the lock. So I have to keep the rack in the down position full-time." Otherwise it is robust and excellent, especially without extension. Help Thule pls!!
review.name: Good, but...

review.itemreviewed: T2 Pro XT - 2 Bike Hitch Rack Add On
review.reviewBody:
This extension has 3 major problems:
1. The handle doesn't work, even when connected correctly. I can use the handle to move the lock latch a bit, but not enough to toggle the lock. So I have to keep the rack in the down position full-time.
2. The extension bolt holes don't line up correctly so you have to screw the bolts in at a slight angle and they only go in about half way.
3. The rack bounces up and down so much when driving over uneven pavement that the arms pop off the front tires of the bikes and the bikes flop over mid-drive.
review.name: Barely Usable
comment:
Hello Jason,
Thank you for letting us know about the issues you experienced with your Thule T2 Pro XT Add-On. A representative reached out directly to provide some assistance in getting the rack operating as intended.

review.itemreviewed: T2 Pro XT - 2 Bike Hitch Rack Add On
review.reviewBody:
I love the add-on rack but...

After taking three hours to install, the HitchSwitch lever handle is very difficult to pull to tilt up and down. I have to use all my strength to pull the lever and it will not snap in place to lock. I have to push the lever down so it would be in the lock position.
review.name: HitchSwitch lever hard to pull.

review.itemreviewed: T2 Pro XT - 2 Bike Hitch Rack Add On
review.reviewBody: Spent 3 hours trying to install this thing. Seems to be a manufacturing defect (extra piece of plastic) that is blocking the handle from full movement. Could try and jerry rig it, but at this price point it should be an easy seamless experience to take on and off. If you can get this to work, you definitely would not be switching it back and forth from a 4 to 2-bike rack.
review.name: Absolute Trash
comment:
Thank you for contacting Thule and sharing your feedback. 
I understand your frustration with the defective piece of your bike rack. A small production run of the Thule T2 Pro XTR had a mis-formed handle that can easily be replaced. I reached out via email to start that process and get the new handle shipped out. 
The connection between the base bike rack and add-on needs to be strong and secure to support the additional weight of the add-on and mounted bikes. This can make the add-on difficult to remove, but ensures safe travels. Some lubrication like white lithium grease or spray silicone during installation can help the add-on slide into place and be more easily removed when needed.

review.itemreviewed: T2 Pro XT - 2 Bike Hitch Rack Add On
review.reviewBody: We just received our add on and installed the unit. Despite what others have said about fit and build quality ours fit with no issues and works great. The only draw back was the lack of detailed instructions but with the other rack I was able to figure out the wheel attachments. Overall great product.
review.name: Great Add on

review.itemreviewed: T2 Pro XT - 2 Bike Hitch Rack Add On
review.reviewBody:
Pro: permanently changes your T2 Pro XT from 2-bike mode to 4-bike mode, if you need to transport 4 bikes.

Con: as others have said, the manufacturing tolerances on this product are very poor, and this was one of the most difficult and frustrating product installations I've ever done in my life.  That said, I was able to get it installed, but most people I know would not have been able to do it themselves.  

The add-on's steel frame would not slide nicely into the steel frame of the T2 Pro XT.  I had to use a 2x4 and a hammer to hammer it in place.  (Add-on was too large and the original unit's receiving hole was too small).  This makes it absolutely impossible to ever remove it without damaging, and it made the install very difficult. 
 Then, the screw holes did not line up well, meaning I had to hammer the thing back and forth repeatedly just to get the screws to even be able to thread in.  Finally, for the mechanism that attaches to the handle, there are 2 blind screws inside deep holes, you have to stick your allen wrench in there and pray for screw engagement, there is no way to see anything.  You can't back out the screw at all.  That step alone took 30 minutes of jiggling, banging, cursing, etc, in order to get the screws to magically line up with their threaded holes.  The worst part?  If you fail at this step of installing the add-on kit, you won't be able to use the original bike rack anymore either because you have already detached these screws, and the mechanism won't work anymore.  

My recommendation is to get this installed at a professional bike shop where they do the hard work for you.  Only get this if you absolutely need 4 bikes on your already-owned T2 Pro XT.
review.name: Get it installed through a shop
comment:
Thank you for reaching out and sharing your feedback! It sounds like some of the challenges you described with the installation could be caused by production issues that would be covered under warranty. 
I sent you an email for some more information and to help get the process started to replace the damaged parts. Please reach out to finalize your warranty and if you have any other questions. 
I look forward to helping get your Thule T2 Pro XT up and running again!

review.itemreviewed: T2 Pro XT - 2 Bike Hitch Rack Add On
review.reviewBody: Really solid and safe bike rack for 4 bikes.  To assemble it, the bolt welds protruded too much to slide into the receiver.  I had to grind them flush to get the add on to slide in.  It can be a 2 or 4 bike rack but it will take some assembly and disassembly to make it work
review.name: Solid bike

name: T2 Pro XT - 2 Bike Hitch Rack Add On

review.itemreviewed: X-Sync 2 Eagle 12-Speed Direct Mount Chainring - Boost
review.reviewBody: My old legs needed just a little more spin for those long sustained climbs and short technical sections so I replaced the stock 32 tooth ring with this fancier machined 30 tooth one. The difference is definitely appreciated and I don’t feel like it’s too low to be useful. Using more of the smaller cogs in back now too so sprockets should last a little longer. Classier look with the gold logos and sharper definition.
review.name: Nice addition

review.reviewBody: Classic pieces. Always a good thing to have tucked away on the back of your harness.
review.name: Gotta have 'em

review.reviewBody: This is the essential kit for starting a rack. Everybody I climb with has at least one set of these classic bomber nuts.
review.name: The Essentials

review.reviewBody: There are only 3-4 outdoor companies I trust for reliability, safety, and quality. Black Diamond is as solid as they come. Stoppers are well-crafted and endure a beating. This is my second set in 25 years.
review.name: Always reliable

review.reviewBody: Great standard set of stoppers- not quite as versatile offset stoppers but pretty good.
review.name: Great standard set of stoppers-

review.reviewBody: Place these correctly and they're absolutely bombproof. I started climbing back in the 70s when stoppers and hexes were just gaining momentum as a replacement for pins. They're just as solid now and still a go-to. Simple to place, lightweight, must-have gear.
review.name: Bombproof Simplicity

review.reviewBody: Ole reliable, definitely a must no matter the crag.
review.name: Always a Classic

review.reviewBody: Not much to say... they work as expected. Hard to mess up a square of metal.
review.name: Simple  / Classic

review.reviewBody: as its called, Classic. A classic set of stoppers. strong, reliable, and always in our pack. At least one set is needed, I mean, who doesn't love the sound of a cow behind you... lol
review.name: Always in the bag of tricks

review.reviewBody: If you need passive pro you can’t go wrong with black diamond stoppers
review.name: Need passive pro

review.reviewBody: I used the neutral version in the past. The color code is awesome!
review.name: Great!

description: Buy the Coleman Skydome XL Tent: 12-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Skydome XL Tent: 12-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Coleman Skydome XL Tent: 12-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Absolutely the best tent I’ve ever had. I have a twin size bed in here and plenty of room to relax. Absolutely love it. Thank you.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: Good quality. Designed nicely for families. Easy to setup
review.name: Good buy.  Great for camping with lots of room

review.reviewBody: This tent is exactly what we were looking for. Great size and has vents all over the place, which we found helpful for summer camping. Setup is relatively easy once you practice a few times. The attached poles do make things easy, but can also be cumbersome when setting up. Other than that, it's 10/10 for us!
review.name: Huge, airy, exactly what we needed.

review.reviewBody: Great tent!  Perfect amount of space for a family of 4 and a dog and all of our gear.  The setup allows for extra open space for changing, playing games. Etc.  the two door design is also great for getting a breeze through during the day and setup using the pre attached poles and color coding was really easy!
review.name: Perfect tent for our family Adventures

review.reviewBody: We got this tent to replace a large family tent (not a Coleman) that was getting old and leaking a ton when it rained.  I had a smaller version of this tent and it always worked great, with the exception of the zipper on the door, which eventually broke, but only after many years of use.  This tent is also great - it kept us bone-dry in the rain, has a lot of space for the family and the dogs, was easy to put up, and was easy to put away.  The only issue I have is that the bar that supports the rain fly over the doors pulls the door so tight that the stitching was starting to pull out on the zipper on the first day of use.  Again, the tent is great otherwise, but will be disappointing if the door becomes unusable so soon.
review.name: Great Tent, but door needs some attention

review.reviewBody: This tent was life changing. I’m not a camper. I wanted something I could stand up in to get dressed and fit multiple air mattresses. Having a spot to run an electrical cord in and plug in a fan and coffee pot is amazing. I’m taking off a star bc the zipper is super annoying. It’s constantly getting stuck and you can’t zip/unzip one handed. I still love the tent and would recommend to anyone. Putting it together definitely took more than 5 minutes the first time lol. But set up/take down is super easy-once you get the hang of it.
review.name: Excellent tent-fix zipper

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This 12 person skydive tent is pretty impressive. Its spacious size provides plenty of room for comfortable tenting. Very easy set up and tare down. The material is of great quality. I am confident this tent will last the numerous camping trips that are planned.
review.name: Great tent

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] No doubt hands down the best weekend tent for my family. It didn’t take very long at all for myself and my wife to put this up. Our boys enjoyed the weekend camping experience and this tent made overnight so much easier. We didn’t have any rain but the ground was slightly wet from the day before and we didn’t even notice once inside. The inside heigh is great for us and made moving about unpainful.
review.name: Very durable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Coleman 12 person Skydome XL tent is massive. It is suitable to fit four queen air mattresses. The poles are pre-attached and set-up was uncomplicated. Even though it took longer than five minutes. It took twenty minutes to complete. The doors are wide to walk into and out of. Inside the tent there is a sufficient amount of pockets for arranging items and a room divider for privacy.
review.name: big tent

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This tent is bigger than I expected it to be but it is a good thing! I am so used to tents that are small and compact and it’s just not enjoyable sometimes. This tent is perfect for our family when we go on a camping trips. My kids and my nephews loved the space! The height of this tent is pretty tall as well. We can all walk comfortably inside and don’t have to hunch down. Setting it up is very easy as well. The materials used for this tent are high quality materials. I highly recommend it for bigger families or groups.
review.name: Bigger than expected!

name: Skydome XL Tent: 12-Person 3-Season

description: Buy the Outdoor Research Balebreaker Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Balebreaker Pant - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Balebreaker Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Nothing slim about these pants. Waist is smaller than marked and seat/legs/hem are as sloppy as a trash bag. Award winning? Perhaps the fabric is great but the fit is terrible. Excess material in outdoor clothing hinders performance. I own several Outdoor Research products but they missed the mark on these pants.
review.name: Baggy as 80s parachute pants

review.reviewBody: I bought these pants to give me a thicker and more casual pant to wear to the crag and to the pub on the way home. These are ideal. The fit is trim looking while still not limiting mobility. The thicker material blocks the wind nicely and kept my legs on the hotter side of warm on a windy and cloudy 10 degree C day. The integrated belt provides great and comfortable adjustments while not adding any bulk under a harness. A few more increments would be amazing but that is a nitpick. Only con so far is that after three days of use one the pockets is starting to come unsewn. Should be an easy fix but shouldn't be happening this faster either. I am 180cm and 81kg. The 32in waist fit perfectly and the 30in inseam works great for over casual shoes and keeps the hem out of the way on the wall.
review.name: Great pants for the City and the Crag

review.reviewBody: Fantastic fit. Bought a second pair! Need a khaki color!
review.name: Another Winner

name: Balebreaker Pant - Men's

hasVariant.name: Basis Tech Pant - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Backcountry Basis Tech Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Basis Tech Pant - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Backcountry Basis Tech Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Same as someone else reviewed, the belt loop ripped at the point it was sewn to the pants. Only wore the pants three times. The right side zipper seems a bit suspect in terms of long term quality as it's just out from behind some pocket cloth and has a plastic sheath on the zipper pull that seems like it'd snap if pulled too hard.
review.name: Belt Loop Ripped At Pants Attachment

review.reviewBody: These pants were my go-to for the 4 months I had them until the belt looped ripped out. Didn't catch it on anything, just cleanly ripped out putting a belt on one day. Pretty disappointing because i loved these pants.
review.name: Great pants, bad design

review.reviewBody: Quality pant. Fit is spot on.  However the zipper is quite front and center and definitely a main focal point of the pant. The pictures do not accurately represent the impact of the leg zipper. As such this cannot be anything more than casual. Not appropriate for even business casual.
review.name: Quality pant, zipper is ok obtrusive

review.reviewBody: Nice looking pants, but unique design of belt loops, resulted in bottom attachment of loop pulling through the pants on 1st use
review.name: Had to return item

review.reviewBody:
I think that the Tech Pant title is rather deceptive, these pants are, as far as I can tell, the same as the Basis Everyday Pant with the addition of a thigh pocket.  The current fashion definition for Tech Pant is very wide and seems like it can be anything from dress pants, to chinos, to pants actually made for technical outdoor activities as long as they have some stretch material.  

As for the actual pants.  I really like the stretch canvas, and while the sizing does run large, I like the fit.  It is easy to move around in, and not at all constricting.  Other than the hidden pocket, which needs to be tacked down so I don't have to position it every time I pull the pants up.  It is a very solid everyday pant, but it will not be replacing my Fjallraven Keb trousers, or any of my other actual technical pants for demanding outdoor activies.
review.name: Everyday Pants with a thigh pocket

review.reviewBody: These pants have great stretch making them very comfortable while the fabric still looks rugged and outdoorsy. I get a lot of compliments on them, the slender fit looks amazing. They do feel a half size large, so I got both 30 and 32. I like having both sizes, 32 when I want a looser fit and 30 when I want a more slender fitted look.
review.name: Great Look

name: Basis Tech Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: I bought these for several international trips last summer. I can't recommend them enough! I've walked hundreds of miles on all types of terrain (cities, mountains, deserts, forests, I've tried these everywhere) completely comfortably. They have not caused any blisters or other issues. I wore them on a couple of very rainy days and they dried out relatively quickly. I am now 6 months into owning them and I've worn them A LOT and just the fabric on the heels is starting to wear out. All in all, very happy with them!
review.name: Very comfortable

review.reviewBody: I considered many many different boots before deciding on these Merrells. At this price point, the quality and comfort can’t be beat. I have high arches and bad knees and these boots provide a comfy sole without sacrificing stability. The leather and tread feel durable and the boots are all around well made. Happy to see Merrell has maintained quality while it seems like everything else is cheapening out. Highly recommend for causal day hiking!
review.name: LOVE!
comment: Thank you for the great review!

review.reviewBody: Very disappointed. Not as red as the photo and a smaller,  narrower fit than my current Moab Speeds which I love. The fabric is also very wrinkly and loose across the toes. Sent them back
review.name: Disappointing

review.reviewBody: Bought these for an international trip and they've been great for walking and minor trekking. Didn't even need breaking in.
review.name: Good travel shoe

review.reviewBody:
Very sturdy for walking on pavement  and trails. 
They has a long time. Prices are so high now I want them to last.
review.name: A good all round shoe

review.reviewBody: These sneakers were so comfortable right out of the box. Besides being comfortable, they are also stylish and can be worn shopping or hiking.
review.name: The most comfortable sneakers I've ever worn

review.reviewBody: Fantastic tread. I feel safe on our hilly gravel track.
review.name: Good Gravel Grip

review.reviewBody: great hiking shoe -light and super comfortable. would recommend
review.name: great hiking shoe

review.reviewBody: These sneakers are awesome! did not have to break in. Was very comfortable from 1st time putting on!!
review.name: COMFORTABLE
comment: Thank you the awesome review!

review.reviewBody: Supremely comfortable and attractive enough to be able to use as streetwear as well as for bushwalking.
review.name: Very comfortable

description: Buy the S.O.L Survive Outdoors Longer Emergency Bivvy online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Emergency Bivvy
hasVariant.description: Buy the S.O.L Survive Outdoors Longer Emergency Bivvy online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is an easy and convenient item to add to an emergency kit! It’s a great option to even keep in a vehicle when you live somewhere with cold weather.
review.name: Emergency

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My husband is so excited about this bivvy! He’s prepared for every occasion and this will be the perfect addition to his hunting bag! Hoping he doesn’t have to use it, but so nice it is available
review.name: Prepare for the unexpected

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The bivvy helps regulate body temperature and managed to keep my father warm when he had to sleep outdoors. He did find that the whistle wasn’t really powerful, so not sure if it could really be called a rescue whistle. The whistle is attached to the bivvy holder making it easy to have on hand.
review.name: Regulates body temperature

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It is a very good product! Looks very durable, as the material is thick and very well made. It is awesome to have in the camping stuff as it is very small. I genuinely recommend this product!
review.name: Good quality

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My husband is so excited about this bivvy! He’s a pepper for every occasion and this will be the perfect addition to our camping bag! We can’t wait to use it
review.name: Awesome bivvy!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice and compact to have in case of emergencies. Plan on keeping it in my car to provide warmth in case of getting stuck in the winter. Seems durable and held up to waterproof testing in the package. I don’t know how easy it would be to get back in package after use but hopefully you never need it more than once.
review.name: Good quality for emergencies

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Received from Influenster in exchange for my honest review. 

This is my first time getting a product from  SOL, and it was something that I didn’t realize that I needed. I think that everybody should have one of these in case of emergencies. It comes in a compact box and you can carry it anywhere. I’ll be in my car, especially since there are very heavy winters where I live. This includes a protection shelter, it’s lightweight, and holds heat and is also waterproof. It also has some other versatile features such as a rescue and a tinder cord. I feel safe having this on hand! For the price it’s a great item to keep your mind at ease in an emergency.

Recommend to anyone, those who have a car should probably store one in case of an emergency and it really is so compact you barely notice!
review.name: Safety in a portable box!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is compact. It is light. It can be a life saver. My son had an accident out in the country some years ago. It was below 0. It took time to get to him and find him. I was very happy to get this because it would have helped home so much. With a waterproof blanket and an ability to stay warm, everyone should have these. I put it straight into his SUV. I feel better knowing he has this kit. It will be easy to locate. I plan to get a couple more for each vehicle.
review.name: Life Saver

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are important in case of emergencies or hiking and camping and very important to have on outdoor trips they come in very handy when you find yourself in a spot
review.name: These are important

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Received this product to try. First the packaging is wonderful and obviously this is for emergency use so it’s on my boat currently. However the packaging is nice and I did use it and it’s a pain to fold back up hence why I say emergency use. It is warm though and water proof when wrapped in it.
review.name: Small and compact

name: Emergency Bivvy

review.name: Excellent quality glove! Keeps hands

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great fit, warm and insulated without the bulk. Can still grip what I need to in the cold.

review.reviewBody: Amazingly warm and dry gloves! Spent the week in Jackson Hole and no issues in negative 13 degree temps. These gloves are the best and unbeatable at any price… but the price was great too! Love the gear coming out of this company and will always look to 686 first!

review.reviewBody:
I’m more in to Gucci shoes than hiking boots but I try to stay active in the coastal California climate after growing up in metropolitan Florida. These are amazing! I’m buying one in every color! 

They’re great for not adding too much bulk and I can sneak it over a sports bra and under a Burberry trench to extend the operating temperature of a more fashionable coat and my own dislike of significant layers.
review.name: Warm, comfortable, not too ugly

review.reviewBody: When I first took it out from the package to try it on, it was shedding a whole lot. However, I hand washed it and it turned out a bit better afterwards. It does feel warm so I do recommend!
review.name: Warm!

review.reviewBody: This jacket is a soft dream! I wore it first day after receiving it and got so many compliments! It is super soft and warm in 30F degree weather. And the color is beautiful, definitely stands out.
review.name: I will definitely buy in another color.

review.reviewBody: The fleece quality was nice but the cut was fuller than I wanted. I returned the jacket and will hope to find a jacket with a more flattering fit for my body type. The jacket was soft and would be fine as a casual throw- on jacket, especially if you want to layer.
review.name: Plush black fleece full cut

review.reviewBody: This is a beautiful soft jacket that I will be wearing in the cooler weather. It is very comfortable and very well made.
review.name: I would buy this product again.

review.reviewBody: This is a great outdoor jacket. It is buttery soft and very comfortable.
review.name: I would buy this product again.

review.reviewBody: Super soft and I love the color. I want to love it but the neck is too high so I am returning it. My previous Osito jacket's neck fits perfect.
review.name: neck is too high

review.reviewBody: The best warmth and cozy feeling in a jacket. My new go to daily jacket.
review.name: Yes

review.reviewBody: I had my last Osito Jacket for about 3 years of heavy use and finally had to replace it last month. Hubby and I work remote and travel a lot, my Osito jacket comes on every trip! It is the perfect weight and form for everything you might encounter. Going to be warmer? well t-shirt underneath, unzipped and rolled up sleeves. Going to be colder? sweater underneath or coat over top. I have worn it everywhere from the Egyptian desert to the mountains of Japan, hiking and going to Yoga. I have worn everything from nothing underneath it (long story lol) to a full wet suit. It packs really well traveling because the fabric is very airy and compresses a lot. By the way my favorite thing is how soft the inside is, feels great against the skin!
review.name: Perfect light weight jacket for everything!

review.reviewBody: So warm and so light! I buy this jacket for all of my kids and myself.
review.name: Lightweight and so warm

name: Osito Jacket - Women's
Osito Jacket - Women's

description: Buy the La Sportiva Solution Climbing Shoe online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Solution Climbing Shoe
hasVariant.description: Buy the La Sportiva Solution Climbing Shoe online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I know the trend is toward softer and softer shoes; but I still like stiffness. Indeed, after a couple of years with a pair of Solution Comps, I decided I liked the stiffness of the original Solution better.  It just gives me more confidence on smaller pieces. I don't expect pure boulderers to agree with me; but if you are still doing roped climbing through small features; the Solution might be the "solution" for you as it is for me.
review.name: Stiffer vs Softer = My Preference

review.reviewBody: Ive had my solutions for about 3 months now, and i can say they are the best shoe ive owned. I immediatly was able to climb v8, where before I was stuck at v7 for months. Would absolutlely recommend!
review.name: Best shoes on the market

review.reviewBody: Favorite Climbing Shoe! My street shoe sizes is 7.5 I own these in 39 and 39.5 Based on the size chart I should have 38.5 but it's too small and uncomfortable. 39 fits perfect and I wear them  in cooler ideal climates and 39.5 are a little loose which I wear in warmer temps when my feet are a little swollen from heat. I use these for all sport climbing, vertical and overhanging. I own the women's version as well and don't really notice the difference.
review.name: Favorite Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody: I've had this shoe for a couple months now and I can say that these live up to the hype. They edge very well, and heel hook like no other. They can even hold their own on the slab. However, I have a couple complaints about this shoe. The main issue is, after 2+ hours of use a huge blister forms on my big toe. Taping my toe doesn't seem to help it at all. However, this could just be a me thing, so this might not apply to you. Also, the break-in period was the worst break-in period i've ever had. These HURT for the first few weeks. However, they now feel great.
review.name: Great shoe, with some flaws

review.reviewBody: love the shoe i had a pair of the old modal and they were amazing and lasted long the new model in the same size don't fit they are to big in the new modal witch is a shame as i don't fit them but they were my favorite shoe.
review.name: sizing

review.reviewBody: I've had these shoes for less than a month and the straps on one of them are already coming apart after working on a project with a toe hook on an arete. While breaking them in hasn't been easy the shoes fit really nice. Probably my last pair that has straps and not laces.
review.name: Fits great but straps break fast

review.reviewBody: I’ve had these for 2-3 weeks and after every session some bright yellow residue is left on my feet. It’s not toxic or smelly but it’s pretty gross looking.
review.name: Great fit and performance, but yellow residue

review.reviewBody:
We all are on a journey to find the Holy Grail of climbing shoes, meaning a shoe that enables us to climb better and achieve at levels we have hoped for.  For me, that journey led me to try the Solution.  After a brief break in period, they are really my favorite climbing shoes and enable me to climb 1-2 grades higher than before, plus get into bouldering in an enjoyable fashion.  Funny, I ran into a young lady at the local gym that was about to order her 4th, yes 4th, simultaneous pair of Solutions!!  I don't know why she thinks she needs that many pairs at the same time; but I'm sure her Gearhead at Backcountry loves her, because she says  she gets all her gear here.  Inspired by her, I got a 2nd pair up 1/2 size to use when I'd like to keep my shoes on for more than one pitch and don't need the last scintilla of performance I can get with the tighter size on.  
POSTSCRIPT:  Bizarre: One year later, my feet have grown a full size; so now I have a pair of these Solutions in 46 and a pair of the Solution Competitions in 45.5.  I wear these Solutions 75% of the time and go down to the Solution Comps when I am trying a route or project that requires more precision.  I just think these shows are incredible!!!
review.name: The Holy Grail

review.reviewBody:
I’ve been wearing solutions since I bought my first pair of high performance shoes. I love love them so much! 
I can’t count how many I’ve gone through but it’s not only my aim outdoor shoe but also gym shoes. These babies heel hook like a boss and stick to anything. I trust them and wouldn’t trad these for any other shoes.
review.name: Best climbing shoe out there!

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love these shoes. I still remember the first time I tried them on, I saw a great improvement in my climbing. The stitching still holds, no ripping or anything breaking down over the years, still climb like new.
review.name: Used for over 2 years now

review.reviewBody: Replacing an older TNF Goretex hard shell that held up for a very long time until the zippers failed. First impressions is that the number of pockets and their positioning is exactly the type of thing you didn't know you needed until you have it. Feels light and offers good maneuverability. Just roomy enough that layering with mid layer doesn't feel bulky and stuffed. Although the armpit area is a bit snug, I have a Denali fleece so maybe the newer FutureFleece models will fit better. I have high hopes this jacket will hold up for years snowboarding here on our icy slopes. I'm already liking the tech designed into this jacket.
review.name: Well designed functionality

review.reviewBody: This jacket is so advanced, I'm starting to think Tony Stark designed it in his spare time. It's like wearing a mini Iron Man suit on the mountain - flying although will be up to you. Highly recommend. Medium size 5'9" 180lbs.
review.name: Tony Stark's Snowboard Jacket
