hasVariant.name: Heavy Metal Gear Sling
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Heavy Metal Gear Sling online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I needed a new chest harness for Single Rope Technique in vertical caving. I was looking at more traditional chest harnesses for SRT, but when I saw this one from Black Diamond, the additional gear attachments points and ease of adjustability drew my attention. I was skeptical to give it a shot, but decided to try it. I am happy to say this is my new favorite chest harness!! Super comfortable and adjustable. Love the added gear loops for radios, etc. Having a more secure and convenient radio attachment point will hopefully prevent radio #3 from taking a 125+ plunge down a pit.
review.name: Bought as a chest harness, love it!

review.reviewBody: How people rack their gear is a very personal thing. That said, if you are going to rack with a shoulder sling this is definitely a great one to choose. It distributes weight evenly around you torso and allows you to easily organize the gear so it is accessible. Thanks BD for a great product.
review.name: GEAR Sling

review.reviewBody: Compared to other dual sling racks, this starts as a chest harness and adds storage capacity. The front tie point is bomber. The dual adjustment straps on either side of the tie point work very well. The only downside I see is if you were to remove the harness while racked (say, at a belay and swapping leads) it will be tough to get out of since you slide this harness over your head. It would be nice to have an opening up front to ease this move or else plan on reracking on another harness/sling for a lead swap.
review.name: Robust harness

name: Heavy Metal Gear Sling

review.reviewBody:
I had a pair of bcX11 for years. Many miles in Co and NM mountains/turns with Fisher 88 skis. 
Going for new bindings and will replace my 3pins with NNNBC. 
The bcX10 are close to my old boots and should work well. They are lighter weight and do not have ratcheted otter tightened. 
End of season purchase. Eager for next season.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very comfortable and lightweight to wear at work or outside on cooler days.
review.name: LOVE THE COLOR AND THE SOFTNESS OF THE JACKET

review.reviewBody: This is the perfect sweater for me.  I like the arm length, not too short for stretching out over my bicycle handle bars. A large is the best fit for me, but sometimes I need to go XL just to get the arm length.  I got this in a large and it fits nice without any extra bulk.
review.name: Perfect sweater

name: Leconte Fleece 1/2-Zip Jacket - Men's

description: Buy the Bogs Snownights Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Snownights Boot - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Bogs Snownights Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: an okay boot, though it isn't as easy as it seems to slip in and out. Also they hold on to dirt, between the tracks would be okay, but the fabric holds on to mud. It can't be simply rinsed off.
review.name: Not what I was looking for

review.reviewBody: Nice boots but did not work for me. I ordered the 1/2 larger and they were still difficult to pull on. The molding around the heel would collapse as I was trying to push my foot in. Returned them and now getting the winter rain boots instead.
review.name: Did not work for me

review.reviewBody: Great boots for Chicago weather!! I am so happy with my choice of brand and style.
review.name: The best boots ever

review.reviewBody: I love these boots. They are warm and keep my feet dry. Plus they are beautiful. I get compliments every time I wear them!
review.name: Yes I would but them again!

review.reviewBody: Beware... I read reviews before my purchase, but bought them anyway. To say that they run small is an understatement. 2 sizes up minimum needed for me, another half size for when it's cold & I wear heavier socks. Not only is the foot part small, the tall calf part will fit only those with relatively thin calves unless you want to cut the laces that the boots come with. For me, these boots will need to withstand high water, mud, snow, and cold temps. The verdict on that is yet to be determined.
review.name: Just received. Run super small!

review.reviewBody: They are great for everyday boots. They are definitely not for a wide foot, luckily I have skinny feet. Completely waterproof. Takes a few wears to break them in
review.name: Love them

review.reviewBody: Very hard to get on. Working on getting them returned.
review.name: Poor design.

review.reviewBody: Much much much much smaller had to return and still didn't get the money back!!!! Beware does not fit true to size at all runs very small
review.name: Had to return still waiting for my money runs very small!!

review.reviewBody: I like the color of the boots. The lining is warm. The sole is very hard and inflexible. The boot itself provides little to no support. It's very floppy. It's hard to walk in these boots. They are very uncomfortable.
review.name: Very firm sole. Floppy boot.

review.reviewBody: These boots are super comfortable and have great tread. I've worn them at 10 degrees and I'm skeptical they'll be warm at -22. I'm a little bummed because that's the sort of boot I was hoping for but I'm going to keep them.
review.name: Super comfortable! Likely not warm to -22.

review.reviewBody: I’ve had this jacket for a bit over a year and the inner part of the neck (when zipped to the top) is pulling and wearing. As well, the jacket fit very tight across the upper chest, shoulders.
review.name: Fits tight

review.reviewBody: This is one of the nicest cut jackets I've ever owned. It's surprisingly functional and technical in the cold, wind, and wet and also very breathable. I wear it to the office a lot because it dresses up really well too. However, I'm on my second jacket and both times, within 1 season of wearing it, the material on the inner neck has started to pull and wear. I really hope they fix this, because other than that, I'd definitely keep this as a staple piece in my closet.
review.name: Great fit and function but really poor durability.

review.reviewBody:
After losing a lot of weight and never really having a nice jacket, I decided I would finally make an meaningful investment for this winter - and many more winters to come. I was shocked and impressed at the light weight of the jacket. The insulating properties are average for this type of jacket. I live in Florida. However. during the winter, our temperatures at night can easily and consistently be 30 and 40 degrees F, in January (about 0 - 4 C, for the rest of the world that uses 'science numbers'). If active, per the temperatures I listed above, no layering may be needed. Though, I typically wear a shirt and then my HH fleece at the mid layer, for this mid-layer jacket.

 My only two gripes are minor in nature. The sleeves tend to be about 25mm too long. However, maybe by design this is intended. I am not sure. When I wear one or two items below the jacket, the extra length of the arms is no longer an issue. Without the extra layers, the sleeves almost roll into the base of my palms. This can be dangerous in certain applications. My last gripe - and the most annoying thing - about the jacket is the YKK zipper. I've used YKK zippers in this past. This is consistently the worst experience with a 'quality' zipper I've ever had. It's extremely hit-or-miss, per se. The male-end of the sipper simply will not align into the open ends of the two zippers, sometimes. I can literally try ten times to create proper alignment for zipping. Other times, I can align the male-end to the open sides of the zipper with no isssue(s). But at least eighty percent of the time, I am spending at least twenty or thirty seconds to properly align all the elements to crate a successful zipping pattern. 

Despite those issues, this is almost the best jacket I have purchased. Below,

I'm 5' 6'' / 168 cm.
Weight is 145 pounds / 65.7 kg
Waist is 29'' / 73.6 cm
Chest is 36'' / 91.4 cm
review.name: A Very Good Daily and Mid Layer

review.reviewBody:
I bought this to wear a thin sweater underneath but upon receiving it, quickly noticed that I will not be able to do this. It is pretty snug. 

Great quality however, feels quite warm and is true about packing up small.
review.name: Fit's a bit tight for size

review.reviewBody: I got the cinnamon colored coat- it is very comfortable and much warmer than expected. The color is more of a burnt brown than red though. I still kept it as it's comfortable and warm, needs to be broken in a bit to be less stiff. True to size too which is good since my experience has been some Kuhl tops can run small but this fits well.
review.name: Great but color different in person

review.reviewBody:
I love the colors and style of this jacket - hard decision between cinnamon ganache and the gold/dusty blue. Great quality too, as usual for Kuhl.
I do wish it had a waist cinch to adjust for a more fitted look and cosy effect - and as usual for my large head, I wish it had a roomier hood and collar. I don't quite love the gathered wrists either. I'm keeping it though!
For reference, a small fits with a comfortable amount of room for a thick hoodie underneath and I'm just over 120 pounds, 5'7".
review.name: Love the colors and style

review.reviewBody: Haven't worn it yet because it is way too hot.   However,  it is  very soft on the outside (unlike many of the other similar jackets)  and  very soft and cuddly on the inside.  I know this is going to be my new favorite jacket.    I got in the blue color and it is a very pretty shade of blue.  Also,  in this color can be used for cool summer nights without looking like you have a fall or winter jacket on.    The styling is super cute, and it runs true to size.   I am usually an xs in khul fleeces and jackets, and the xsmall fit me well,  enough room to layer underneath but not looking sloppy.     I am 5',  105 lbs,  34c, and 37.5 hips.    I had also purchased the small, but sent it back because it was way too big.
review.name: My new favorite casual jacket

review.itemreviewed: High Pile Printed Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I placed an order for one of the fleece jackets, I got the complete wrong color. I called and they sent me another one, turned out to be the complete wrong color again. Their tagging in the system was completely messed up. They told me they would be able to contact the warehouse and get the system fixed and told me it would take a week, it’s been 2 months. Extremely disappointed.
review.name: Messed up

review.itemreviewed: High Pile Printed Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've used it a couple of times and so far it's really comfy and warm.  I would prefer it to be a little more slim fitting, especially around the arms, but that's just a personal choice.
review.name: Warm and cool design.

review.itemreviewed: High Pile Printed Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought this in the Agave Green Print in Size Medium for my partner, and it is sooooo cute on him!!! review.reviewBody: I love my new theragun!! My chiropractor uses a similar device which made me purchase this unit. It is effective for muscle knots and I use it daily and have recommended it to friends
review.name: Theragun

review.reviewBody: I got this product to help my mom, she's gotten a lot of surgeries over the years and is in a lot of pain. The only problem is the lowest setting is still too high for her. I personally like the way it feels on my shoulders at a higher setting. So for me love it but mom not so much. My only complaint and why it doesn't get 5 stars is the charger. It comes with the cord but not the part that plugs into the wall. It doesn't have a usb end so I can't use the power box things I already have around the house. So I have to go buy something just to charge it. I think this company can do better especially since the product cost so much!
review.name: Nice little gun

hasVariant.name: All Around 36L Gear Tote

hasVariant.name: All Around 36L Gear Tote
hasVariant.description: Buy the Backcountry All Around 36L Gear Tote online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this to use as a cargo bike bag to sit inside a rear cargo tray and it has served its purpose well. We have also started to use it as a grocery bag since it holds so much and also doesn't tend to tip over like many taller totes
review.name: Very well sized bag

review.reviewBody: I bought one of these totes on a whim to see if it would work for camping gear, and now I own four of them. This thing is incredibly versatile! It fits perfectly in the top tier of a mini grocery cart so no more plastic bags. Trips to the bike park are a breeze since this thing holds 2 full-face helmets and chest protectors. Don't even get me started on all the uses for camping and the dog cause this will just turn into an editorial. My only wish is that there were more colors so that I could color-code uses. But alas, these will still be my go-to gift for the forseable future because everyone needs one in their life!
review.name: I'd give it 10 stars if I could

review.reviewBody: This tote was way more useful than I thought it. It lives in our car and we use it for everything from pool days, to groceries, to car camping trips.
review.name: Great tote!

review.reviewBody: I love this hear hauler so much! We use it constantly and for everything while we travel. The 36 L size is perfect for the two of us and I find I grab it more often than the larger, name brand cousin we also have. I don’t find the soft sides to be a problem and honestly can’t imagine traveling without this. I highly recommend it.
review.name: Love this gear hauler!

review.reviewBody: I kept forgetting to grab my biking shoes when I left my house for a ride. I put all my gear in here now and absolutely love it! I haven't forgotten anything since and had some extra gear that has come in handy too. My wife got one too and likes hers as well. I wish it had a divider in the middle to separate dirty shoes from the rest of the gear. Probably the only thing that will keep me from using it this winter for skiing too.
review.name: Awesome tote gor not forgetting gear

review.reviewBody: I wasn't sure about the kinda awkward square shape of this bag when I first got it, but turns out to be super functional! The large square bottom (that's a 15" PC in the pic) makes it be squat to be able to carry bulkier gear in a lower Volume bag, which I think is super handy. This ended up being the perfect laundry bag for me out of happenstance (I was at the laundromat, the bag was empty in my truck...).  I was able to load it up easily with folded pants / shirts / skivvies...typical laundry items...but it made it so much easier to transport and keep my things organized. Someone said the sides collapse, I did not find that to be the case on the bumpy ride back to my camp. I am also appreciating all the features like the handle on the sides to be able to pull it out of tight spaces. It is currently residing under my bed, where I used to keep an awkward mesh laundry bag, but the squatness and squareness of it help it fit perfectly under my bed and easy to pull out for laundry days. And the material is so easy to clean! Perfect for that dirtbag lifestyle. It would also make a really good climbing gym bag with that wide opening.  I'm so in love with this bag I think I'll get a second for the originally intended purpose I had when I bought the bag - hauling gear.
review.name: Skeptic turned lover of this bag!

review.reviewBody: 12/10 recommend this bag. Carries everything I need and is easy to clean.
review.name: Awesome Carry All

review.reviewBody: I have loved this bag as my way to carry all of my gear to the mountain! I have my boots, helmet, gloves, googles, and jacket all in this 36l tote. I am especially excited to use this when the warmer weather comes as I can use this for multiple occasions. I would recommend getting the next size up if you are fitting more than the items I have listed.
review.name: Ski Bag

review.reviewBody: Didn’t think I needed one until I got one! Seriously, this gear tote is perfect for any outdoor activity. I’m currently using it to hold all my mountain bike gear and extra clothes for after rides. The 36L is perfect for those day trips to the park, the lake, skiing, climbing, camping and even for road trips to keep your goodies organized and easy to grab.
review.name: Always by my side!

name: All Around 36L Gear Tote

review.reviewBody: Swell boots at another swell price.  Thank you, Ariat, from the tips of my toes to the top of my head.
review.name: Darlin Ariat Ankle Boots

review.reviewBody: Ordered 2 more pairs of Ariats . They came out n last night . I got a pair of these Darlins & the Sterling Cora.  Christmas 🎄 Present for myself. I am in love with them. The colors are amazing & the fit is great too. Ariat is my go to brand for boots 👢 now.  13 pairs is a bit of an overkill or obsession. But I love wearing them and a girl has to have a different pair for whatever outfit she’s wearing.
review.name: Awesome !! Peace, Love & Ariats 👢

review.reviewBody: The boots are good quality boots, but I had problems with finding the correct size for these. I currently own a pair of HERITAGE R TOE WESTERN BOOT in 8.5 C Wide, that fit perfectly, so ordered the same size in these!. They were way too tight, so exchanged for next size up 9 C Wide, which were also too short! I placed the size 9 C Wide in these next to the boots I have and they are visually at least an inch shorter. I have not tried to go another size up. If you have wide feet, I would go a whole size up in these!
review.name: Great boots, but sizing does not match HERITAGE R

review.reviewBody: Good quality bootie. Very comfortable and runs true to size. I like the style of this bootie because it does not have the sides cut out and they do not rub against my ankles. I have been an Ariat boot fan for a long time and this style does not disappoint.
review.name: Looks just like the pic

review.reviewBody: Love these, so comfy. Got them in black and brown and would buy more in other colours. Perfect length which looks great with jeans, leggings, skirts or dresses. Easy to get on with side zip. Highly recommend.
review.name: Soooo comfy

review.reviewBody: These boots are very good looking with jeans and dresses.
review.name: Love these boots!

review.reviewBody: Love my new boots.. They are perfect for dresses or pants. I did get the wide because boots are always tight on my thick foot and they fit perfect!
review.name: Great boots

review.reviewBody: These are way too narrow.  I ordered the wide because the other two standard width boots are a little on the snug side.  The wide in these is more narrow than my other boots.  Absolutely loved the style, but sad I couldn't keep them
review.name: Wide is too narrow
comment: We strive to deliver great product and service, so we’re sorry to hear you were disappointed. If you are willing to share more feedback on how we can help, please email info@ariat.com so that we can better assist you.

review.reviewBody: These arrived today, they seemed on the tight side at first but after my first wear they are beginning to feel really comfortable. Colour (sassy brown) was lighter than expected but overall really pleased with them. Think these are going to be my ‘go to’ boots this winter!
review.name: Great boots - colour lighter than expected.

review.reviewBody: I bought these boots recently and they are easy to wear, look amazing and are very well made. High quality leather and stitching makes them durable. They look good with dresses and tights or jeans or leggings
review.name: Stylish, comfortable and well made boots

name: Darlin Western Bootie Narrow - Women's

review.reviewBody: This perfect for winter. My kid loves it and doesn't complain anymore about riding his bike in the morning.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Highly recommendable, fulfills what it promises, and the price is fair. North Face made my winter feel like summer

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The North Face Freedom Fleece Balaclava is a winter essential! The fleece is luxuriously soft, providing excellent warmth without overheating. The design offers full coverage while remaining breathable, and the adjustable drawstrings ensure a perfect fit. It's my go-to for chilly adventures, from skiing to morning runs. The thoughtful details, like vents for easy breathing, make it a standout. If you want top-notch warmth and comfort, this balaclava is a five-star choice! ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

review.reviewBody:
No question these are the most versatile goggles on the market. Toric and cylindrical lenses are options, the field of view is solid, and the lens change system is unrivaled. The Perceive lenses add contrast and detail in bright and low light.

For flaws, on two different lenses there was internal fogging in the top right corner to start, and one situation became significant condensation inside the lens. The MFI mask is way thick and I found it hard to breath in, in addition to just adding lots of bulk around the neck which interfered with zipping up layers.

Lastly these are pretty big googles, so they aren't for all face sizes, but thus far they've paired up with several helmets without issue.

Overall really good, maybe great, but there's compromises.
review.name: Technically awesome, with some flaws

review.reviewBody: These are my favorite goggles. The magnetic lens change is so fast and easy, I can change lenses on the chair with my gloves on. No more cold fingers. The Magnetic facemask was a surprise. I don't think that I will ever own a goggle with out that feature.
review.name: my favorite goggle

name: M4 Cylindrical Goggles

hasVariant.name: Eja Pro 55L Pack - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Eja Pro 55L Pack - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
And time you feel like you have compromised on a pack, it's never a good thing. I have used this several times now, on shorter and longer trips. 

PROS: I like having a brain, and compared to most ultra-light/light packs, this has one; this is the biggest plus. It's lightweight. It has an adjustable torso. The front pouch is deep. The price is ok for a light pack based on others like Hyperlite, Zpak, or Outdoor Vitals. 

CONS: It's not waterproof or even water-resistant; pack liner and pack cover required. As in many other reviews, water access from the sides is horrendous. A bladder is needed otherwise anytime you want water, the pack has to come off, or alternatively just wait for one of your bottles to fall out as you are moving down the trail. I ended up doing a DIY cut and re-attachment of one side mesh for better water access. The mesh material on the side pockets is not durable. There are few attachment points on the shoulder straps for hooking e.g. sunglasses or GPS. It's not a comfortable carry for a load beyond 25lbs; the shoulder straps start to dig in and I feel like I am constantly adjusting hip and shoulder straps for comfort. Sometimes the torso adjustment hooks will come undone (not during carry though). The pockets on the hip belt are small and the one that doesn't zip up is not at all useful given small size and that it doesn't seal. As others have said, the side compression straps awkwardly fit across over the side pockets. 

CONCLUSION: I haven't owned anything from Osprey before and, based on my experience with this pack, I will never purchase Osprey again. The pack feels like it was not carefully developed nor totally tested– and generally it feels like there was a kind of lack of ‘passion’ that went into its development.… maybe that’s unfair. But I don’t get excited packing up my stuff … there is no thrill (maybe it’s the drab colors), and more a sense of concern about how unconformable I will be. Though this is not up there in terms of price point like Hyperlite or Zpaks (which I think will be my next bag), like any pack it’s still an investment and IMHO this Osprey is not worth the money. Spend the extra to get a light pack where the designers really thought and cared about the details.
review.name: A compromise

review.reviewBody: The adjustment fasteners are too small, they do not stay on the loop set. Had to improvise with zipper pulls to keep them from sliding off !!!! Do not recommend this pack.
review.name: Defective adjustment locks

review.reviewBody:
Nov,23
Female, 119 lbs, over 65, 5’6”
Have lumbar fractures. Invested in two UL packs. Don’t use though. Veteran of many long distance hikes. Used really heavy MALE packs, as “they” did not make female anatomy anything. Color not important. Fit is.

The UL packs lack frames and no load lifters and hang;heavier units have heavy frames. Both really hurt, damage my lumbar region. 
For a few more grams and load lifters eja solve health problems for me. Gotta keep wt OFF lower back. The Eja has a
LW frame and Load Lifters, making the fit better for me. Does not hang or hurt shoulders, pack also has place for internal water bladdy. eja Keeps pack off lower back. Side compressor straps puny, ditto no place for pole stowaways. Pricey. Light enough for most without carrying heavy, pack. Do recommend however.
Nothing perfect! Nothing.
review.name: Solves Issues

review.reviewBody: Osprey decided to discontinue it's high-accolades winning Lumina pack (for reasons I still can't fathom), so I purchased what I thought would be Osprey's best replacement. The Eja Pro drew my attention since it is such a lightweight pack at 2 lbs and 55L capacity for the M/L. After trying many other ultralight packs, I always come back to what I consider to be Osprey's superior Airspeed suspension system. My expectations for the Eja Pro were high given my extremely successful, long-term relationship with the Lumina (over 3,000 miles of backpacking). Those expectations may taint my review, but break-ups are hard and rebound relationships are, well, reboundy, but let's dig in: Pros: comfy carry at 25lb load; sturdy fabric; side pockets well angled for access while pack is on; very lightweight; dreamy suspension system; great price Cons: First impression is bad color choice (sorry, but weathered asphalt and bloody bandages are what I immediately thought of....) The main compartment is narrow and difficult to load (compared to Lumina). Hello Barbie? Osprey stole your hip-belt pocket...as in, the right zippered hip-belt pocket is a useless, teeny-tiny size, which to me reads: ""not worth the weight."" Full disclosure: I always wear a fanny pack, since it allows me to keep valuables with me even when my pack is off, so, for me, any hip-belt pockets are kinda useless. The toggles that are used to adjust the frame size irritatingly keep popping out of the holes when I take the pack on and off. Bigger toggles and smaller holes = better design choice. NO attachment straps on shoulder straps?! ACK, WHY?! Lastly, side compression straps OVER the side pockets make it difficult to get gear out without loosening straps, so getting water bottle/rain gear out while wearing the pack is impossible. Also, ACK, WHY?! Still pining for my Lumina, which will forever be known as my first love.
review.name: Avid Lumina Fan Hoping for Comparable Replacement

review.reviewBody: I had to order the xs/s size straps and I needed the strap attachment to have one more attachment higher or the hip belt was above my hips. For this reason, I couldn't even test it.
review.name: Need a small medium, but only XS/S and M/L available.

name: Eja Pro 55L Pack - Women's

review.reviewBody: I have wore this every day while doing snow removal and they have been awesome. Keeps me warm with just this and an outer layer to help keep moisture away from my body while sweating even at below freezing temps
review.name: Amazing product

review.reviewBody: I use it as a bottom layer for saltwater fishing in cold weather. It does the job and is very comfortable.
review.name: Excellent bottom layer

review.reviewBody: Misshaped.  Huge bulges in fabric behind the shoulders.  Cheaply made and terrible QA.

review.reviewBody: with Smartwool I often find it's a hit or a big miss, & this one is a miss. about all I can say good about this Intraknit crew is winter moss is a nice color. The sizing is off. every SWool baselayer, shirt, hoody, sweater, jacket and multiples of many of them, this piece is the only one that runs way to small for me in med, to contrast it I had tried a large which was to large.(this happened with another SW baselayer 100% merino crew.) It also is so itchy I can't wear it next to my skin, an issue I have not experienced before with SW. I also purchased an Intraknit 1/2 zip hoody, medium, it fits great and is comfortable. So the Intaknit crew goes back as a fail.
review.name: Nice Idea

review.reviewBody: Just what I needed. Unbelievable quality and weight.
review.name: Just what I needed. Unbelievable

review.reviewBody: There is no mention made of it here, but if you check the Wahoo Fitness website for these pedals, you will see there is a 180 lb rider weight limit. No weight restriction for the Comp, Zero, or Aero variants. Just be aware.
review.name: There is a 180 lb rider weight limit!

review.reviewBody: Very light. Very smooth when pedaling. Highly recommended.
review.name: Best pedal

review.reviewBody: These are essentially zeroes but an appreciable amount lighter. There a good option when you need to take a little more off without compromising.
review.name: They’re the same, except less.

review.reviewBody: I am sure once I get used to clipping in, I will love them. #TeachAnOldDogANewTrick :)
review.name: So far, so good ...

review.reviewBody: Have been using these pedals for a few weeks now and they are fantastic. Took a couple of rides for either the spring in the cleat to get a little looser or for me to just get used to using them. However once I was familiar with them clipping in and out was a breeze.
review.name: Have been using these pedals

review.reviewBody: Right side pedal has side to side play.....makes a horrible creaking sound and feels wobbly when clipped in....
review.name: pedal side to side play......

review.reviewBody: I received old, dirty, rusted pedals and cleats missing in old packaging. Not once but twice! Customer service was easy to deal with and they obviously accepted to refund me.
review.name: Received old pedals, dirty and missing cleats.

review.reviewBody: I was expecting a hassle-free transition from my previous SPEEDPLAY Titanium system, but that was not the case. The left pedal is tough to engage...it should not be this difficult for a pedal this expensive
review.name: ISSUE with LEFT PEDAL

review.reviewBody:
My old speedplay pedals needed to be replaced. Well, ok, I could have replaced the bearings. But new pedals are so fun!

The pedal replacement itself was easy. It's nice not to have to use a pedal wrench with the new method.

But the cleats were a different story. I simply swapped out the cleats over the same spot and with the same orientation as the old ones, and I found that it wasn't exactly the same position. Stupid me, I did a 50 mile ride the day I switched the cleats out, and I ended up with knee pain. :-( So re-adjustments are needed.

Otherwise, everything is good.
review.name: Surprise In Upgrading from Old Pedals

name: Speedplay Nano Pedals

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Edge Mid Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Dear Salomon Customer Service Team,

I am writing to express my dissatisfaction with the quality of a pair of Salomon hiking shoes I recently purchased. After a single hike, I noticed that the shoes were covered in dirt that I am unable to remove, despite repeated cleaning attempts. Additionally, there are black marks on the shoes that have become permanent and cannot be eliminated.

Given Salomon's reputation for high-quality outdoor gear, I am deeply disappointed by this experience. I hope you will consider my concerns seriously and provide an appropriate solution, such as approving a quality check and possible replacement of these shoes.

Thank you for your understanding and cooperation.

mik
review.name: Persistent Dirt and Black Marks on Salomon Hiking
comment: Hi. For any inconvenience, we apologize. We're happy to reassure you that a case has been opened to address your worries, and we're looking forward to hearing from you. Check your inbox!

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Edge Mid Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: These boots were awesome for maybe 1 month. Very comfortable. After 4 months the soles were completely worn. They have developed holes on the instep of both boots where your toes bend and now let water in. Salomon was always my first pick for boots but I’m highly disappointed with this pair.
review.name: Comfortable… but Poorly Constructed.
comment: Hi. We’re sorry for any inconvenience. We’re glad to confirm to you that a case has been opened to address your concerns, and we’re waiting for your answer. Please check your inbox!

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Edge Mid Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought then because I’m a scientist who has to hike daily for work finding endangered plants. I’m also an influencer with over 400k followers (@sacramentofoodforest) where I teach people about the importance of biodiversity. I had merrels that broke and felt I should try Salomon’s because they are expensive but seemed quality. I was wrong. They broke after two hikes. And little to say I’m sticking with merrel
review.name: Broke in literally two weeks
comment: Hi, we are sorry to hear this happened to you. All our products come with a 2-year warranty against material and manufacturing defects. Please contact our customer service so we can check if this is the case, and we will help you set up a claim. Just follow this link: https://www.salomon.com/contact Thank you.

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Edge Mid Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I’m having issues breaking in my boots for a trip to Rwanda.  I can’t figure out how to reduce a pressure issue on my left inside ankle.  It hurts to wear them.  I leave in 8 days.  Any suggestions.  Boots fit well else where
review.name: Fit
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Edge Mid Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have had these for about a month now, and they are comfortable but poor/cheaply made. The top eyelet on one shoe pulled out after two weeks of almost daily wear, and the nylon lace eyelets are being cut by the nylon-on-nylon sawing of hiking and running. If you wear these shoes on weekends to hike, they will last a season. If you hike and train every day, they will need to be replaced in two months. I also have a pair of the low-cut version, and the same thing happened with the nylon eyelets in only a few days. I had to jerry-rig some eyelets out of p-cord so they wouldn't fall off my feet on a steep descent.
review.name: Comfortable with poor manufacturing quality
comment: Hi. For any inconvenience, we apologize. We're happy to reassure you that a case has been opened to address your worries, and we're looking forward to hearing from you. Check your inbox!

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Edge Mid Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: A piece broke off the first time trying to tie them. Pretty weak manufacturing. Would not recommend.
review.name: Piece broke off first time tying them
comment: Hi. We’re sorry for any inconvenience. We always strive to improve our products and our service.

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Edge Mid Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: It feels like I'm hiking on clouds thanks to Salomon. I highly recommend and I will purchase them again when worn out.
review.name: Great Hiking Shoes

name: X Ultra 360 Edge Mid Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this because I needed to replace another lightweight pair of shoes. I needed a new pair for all-around trekking. The first time I put these shoes to the test was when we went hiking in Yosemite. It has great grip, a light feel, very comfortable, and held up to a 4-hour hike on rocky/sandy/uneven terrain. I didn't have any chafing or blistering.

My only wish is that it has the no-tie elastic band (like my old Columbia shoes) for easy on and off. But that is a very minor gripe.
review.name: Comfortable, light, and perfect fit

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Son muy ligeros muy buen material y super confortablew
review.name: Twnis

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the color and design of the shoe, its very comfortable and easy to slip on and off
review.name: Perfect fit

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Not all that I thought. They are very much boat shoes and not for much else
review.name: Not bad
comment: Thank you for taking the time to provide your feedback!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love these shoes!   I have a "thing" for shoes!  Since my stroke 5 years ago I have limited mobility and now need shoes that offer heel support and are slip-ons.  These shoes fit my needs perfectly - they are snug, but offer a wider toe box and feel great.  Plus they are so cute.  I can't run anymore, but thsee have great traction.  Try them!
review.name: Perfect slip on's with great support

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I already have this particular pair, and they are still in great condition. I just wanted another pair because I really like this shoe. They are comfy and sporty. I'm very happy i found it.
review.name: Happy Camper

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this shoe. I work in healthcare and wear them to work with my scrubs, they look really sharp and the little pink details feel feminine. I get compliments on these all the time. I LOVE the wide toe box and light weight, it feels like I'm not wearing any shoes at all. I also have a second pair that I wear for weightlifting, HIIT classes at the gym. I like that my toes are freely moveable and I can avoid my feet from cramping in them.
review.name: Purchased 3 pairs so far

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very comfortable, great for throwing on and running out the door
review.name: Would love to see more color options of this shoe!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Light, cool, comfortable. I purchased my 1st pair at a store and loved them so much, I ordered a 2nd pair and color online. I plan to purchase the 3rd color, too.
review.name: Own 2 pair, buying a 3rd.

review.reviewBody: I found this shoe so painful I couldn’t get it off fast enough. Tongues that are attached and do not move freely are simply awful for my feet.
review.name: Uncomfortably terrible.

review.reviewBody: Needed a winter parka after moving to Denver and this fits the bill perfectly. Warm and comfy with big pockets. I usually wear a medium but fit a small in this and can still fit sweaters underneath.
review.name: Good stuff

name: Alivio Down Parka - Men's

review.reviewBody: I have wide front-foot and very narrow heel, when I try other brands, there’s always a big empty space in the heel box which makes it impossible to heel hook; my friend recommended this pair to me and wow, they fit my feet so perfectly!
review.name: Perfect precision shoes

review.reviewBody: Runs smaller than other climbing shoe brands, however the size guide is very accurate.

Love these shoes! I am coming from the normal volume Shamans (Yellow/Black) and these fit my feet even better. These shoes are tighter around the top of the toes/forefoot and sides of the heel comparatively to the normal shamans. The LV versions go off women sizes so keep that in mind when buying from Backcountry. I got these LV ones in 11.5 US which is the same length from heel to toe compared to my Yellow/Black shamans 10.5 US.
review.name: Great precision shoe!

review.reviewBody: I bought them after using Evolv Shakra for three years. They are even better. My regular size is 38, and I wear the same size for Shamans but it  took me a while to break them in.
review.name: Love them

review.reviewBody: Backcountry does not specify that these LV shoes are sized using US women's sizing. It would make more sense for evolv to use European sizing for both MV and LV at this point. I ordered my men's size equivalent and had to return them. Backcountry should indicate that these are women's sizes. I have the last Shaman model and love that shoe, so I imagine these are even better but will update once used.
review.name: Women's sizing!

review.reviewBody:
I am constantly on the hunt for a shoe I can love as much as my trusty La Sportiva Katakis, discontinued in the US. The Evolv Shaman seemed promising with its promise of a generous toe box and all-rounder performance. The toe box delivers, it’s very comfortable. Unfortunately, there’s something weird about the heel cup, it feels like it has lumps in it where the fabric pull tab is connected to the heel under the fabric and it digs into my heels in the most aggravating way. 

In terms of sizing, I am always a size 37 in La Sportiva. I had to size up to a USW 8/39 in this shoe.
review.name: Painful heel cup

name: Shaman LV Climbing Shoe

hasVariant.description: Buy the Simms G4 PRO Powerlock Boot - Men's online or shop all Fishing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I fish the rivers of the Rocky Mountains…I am a qualified guide. 
I fish 75+ days a year. I always wade.  My choice of wading has always been a Simms guide boot, because there is no room for compromise. 
The G4 with Powerlock cleats is a superstar. Everything about this boot is state of the art! 
The G4 gives you the confidence to focus on the fishing. It provides a sole that allows you to wade slick freestone rivers and high country streams. The ankle support is noteworthy and appropriate. All while providing supreme comfort. 
I’m pleased with this boot because it so well thought out and designed. 
It gives you a boot that allows you to get to that spot where you can deliver a Caddis to the rising rainbow…After all, in the water your choice of your boots matters a lot!
review.name: A Great wading boot!

review.reviewBody:
Boots have absolutely no grip. TPR cleats do nothing and the aluminum cleats extend past the vibram sole considerably leading to excessive wear and cleat retention issues. 

If you want an expensive pair of shoes for sandy beaches where grip isn't an issue they're great. On a mossy rock you're going to take a tumble.  Otherwise they're insanely comfortable for what it's worth. 

2 stars for the comfort. Otherwise they'd be 1 star.
review.name: Comfortable shoe with no grip.

review.reviewBody: Amazing boot if used Lightly. When guiding or walking on rocks for days over days, they tend to loose the powerlock cleats and locking system is destroyed by rocks thus making the boot unusable.
review.name: Amazing Boot if used lightly

review.reviewBody: comfortable and light weight. great traction with the aluminum cleats.
review.name: Great Boot

review.reviewBody:
Boots are comfortable - look well constructed - find them a little more slippery than my worn out G4 boots ( 4 years - 600 days of fishing)- i feel the aluminum cleats protrude too much and i don’t get much enough contact on the vibram .
I am very happy with them, in every other aspect - 
PS - the laces - very bright ?
review.name: G4 boots

review.reviewBody: I have a pair wore maybe 50 time's on 3rd set of shoe laces. Square holes to be redesign. The  felt on the  bottom is to large and won't  except the aluminum  cleats. My opinion  not worth the money.

I will start out by saying these boots fit like a glove and are true to size! 
I bought them for a two month fishing trip on the South Island of New Zealand. When I first laced them up I was impressed on how well they fit and the great ankle support they provided. 
On this trip I decided not to use the Aluminum Cleats due to fear that they would spook the super spooky fish of NZ. The TPR cleat did a great on the snotty and slick rocks and the ankle support was amazing! 
I fished 40 days straight with them and they held up to all the abuse that I threw at them. 
If you are looking are looking for a one quiver, do it all wading boot these are the ones you want to buy!
review.name: Fits like a glove

review.reviewBody:
Massively improved fit.  Fit is everything on these. Previous iterations, I thought were pretty tight with proper size simms wader stockingfeet. Made it hard for long days. This fit is perfect. 

Lacing system is solid and doesn’t loosen on long days. 

I like the new cleat system. Only reason I didn’t put this as 5 stars is the aluminum quality on the cleats. They wear out faster than I’d expect, but luckily easily replaced. I hope Simms will release a more durable aluminum for replacement cleats.
review.name: Noticeable fit improvement

review.reviewBody: good shoes. Fits well. I haven't tried it at work yet. I recommend
I like the boots however the stud tool is flimsy and broke now what to do

name: G4 PRO Powerlock Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody:
As a Full-Size Adult Male, this fit great. Fits close but not too tight, softy on the inside, and nice long arms so the cuffs don’t pull up when you reach (I’m 5’ 11” with a +2” wingspan).

(Maybe the fit is a little small in absolute tefms—I got a Large but can sometimes go M for base layers. This was great fit for a base layer but maybe too snug if you layered it over anything. But with that caveat, great fit!)
review.name: Great fit

review.reviewBody: Product description for Pebble Peak shows a broad shouldered man wearing a size medium.  My husband is a slim build, who has never worn anything in his life that was bigger than a size medium.  He is 5'11" 32" waist -lower end of the size range for medoum, and this top makes him look like it's a sausage casing.  Make sure you size up if you want comfort of movement.
review.name: Runs SMALL!

name: Lightweight Poly Baselayer Crew - Men's

review.reviewBody: Love my new coat. It's the two tone yellow and white.
review.name: Super sherpa!

review.reviewBody:
The second I tried it on, two fine women I didn’t know came up for a feel. 
Get a size smaller. I got a LARGE(5’10”/179#), and I can conceal a basketball in the front with the space.

Zipper works fine…. you just need to take the EXTRA time to align that thin tab DOWNNNNN thru BOTH zippers, and it goes up as it should.
review.name: Just ordered ANOTHER ONE

review.reviewBody: So some of the comments people mention maybe not being as warm I live where it gets down to minus temperatures and I was surprised how warm I was. I also purchased one for my daughter. She loves it. Someone in the comments mentioned the zipper being a little sticky, and it can be, you just have to pay attention to the zipper other, than that Great fleece jacket.
review.name: This is very warm

review.reviewBody: My new favorite jacket ..: love it !
review.name: Stoic Fleece jacket

review.reviewBody:
Well, good luck keeping your special lady friend from stealing this piece. 
Never before has a garment been so soft warm and downright snuggle worthy.
Is it Tech piece? no. its too heavy and bulky for shredding the gnar.
Is it a super couch lock love blankie?
Yes. Yes it is.
review.name: like snuggling a teddy bear

review.reviewBody: Similar to the previous review, the zipper takes a bit to work, but you really have to pay attention on  it. It also isn't very thick, so it isn't very warm during the cold temps. But it is very room to wear multiple layers underneath. The outside is very soft.
review.name: Pretty nice jacket

review.reviewBody: jacket feels cozy and warm, but zipper would not engage properly. takes tremendous effort to zip up if you are able to engage. very disappointed the manufacturer did not do a simple quality control check. i don’t know how they even zipped it up when packaging.
review.name: Zipper Doesn’t Work

name: MTN Sherpa Full-Zip Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: This women’s specific bag is very warm, and provides a very comfortable sleep zipped or used as a quilt to share with your dog. (Dog definitely in the hooded side). Packs decently, and the stuff sack fleece pillow feature was a great surprise. Perfect for car/traditional site camping, but packable enough for an occasional backpacking trip. I felt the temperature rating could have possibly even been lower.
review.name: Warm and comfortable

review.reviewBody: Bought my wife and I both Bozeman 30 degree sleeping bags and they have been perfect for our winter camping trips!
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody: Really warm and great value for the price. I have big curves and found that it was a little bit snug around my hips. Overall, I would recommend if you’re looking for a good quality sleeping bag.
review.name: Great value for price.

review.reviewBody: While I initially thought these gloves were too small (based on the sizing model), after I broke them in they fit really well. Overall, I really like these gloves. I find my hands get colder now in the winter than they did before. I like that these gloves are water and windproof, and some insulation for warmth. I also really like the fact that they have leather to increase their ruggedness.
review.name: Excellent Gloves!

review.reviewBody: Awesome! 30 minute walk to the ski area this morning in 14 deg BELOW zero, they were great.  According to the sizing chart, I should have been an XS but they felt too small so I got a small. I suggest sizing up.
review.name: WARM!

review.reviewBody: Perfect for the cold temps of Alaska. I thought I should have went a size bigger but they break in and fit perfect
review.name: best gloves in Alaska

review.reviewBody: I bought these shoes for a 50K and these were awesome! Very confortable and responsive. True to size and very fun to run with. They were ready right out of the box. Very good shoes!
review.name: Love these shoes

review.reviewBody:
The Salomon Thundercross is a great trail running shoe with excellent grip and a comfortable ride. It handles technical terrain well, and the cushioning provides a good balance of comfort and stability, even on longer runs. The shoe feels durable and reliable, which is exactly what you’d expect from Salomon.

That said, I wish the shoe had a bit more heel-to-toe drop. Additionally, the toe box feels a little too wide for my preference; a slightly narrower fit would give me a more secure and precise feel on technical trails.

Overall, it’s a solid shoe that I enjoy, but these tweaks could make it even better for runners who prefer a snugger fit and more drop.
review.name: Solid Trail Runner with Room for Improvement

review.reviewBody:
I have had Speedcross runners for several years now and decided to check these out. They are really comfortable but they have less of a drop (only 4mm)! Did a short run in the office and warehouse and my knees were hurting! I did return the shoes as I am an "heel touch the ground first" runner where a greater drop (like the speedcross 6) is required.

I suggest Salomon makes it more clear on their website that this has a low drop!

Don't worry, I will keep buying Speedcross but just not the Thundercross
review.name: Returned them
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody:
Offers a bit more room than other Salomon shoes,
 comfy fit, bouncy ride with great control through the 5mm lugs, so in love with this shoe!
review.name: Great for wider feet!

review.reviewBody: I wanted to love these however the fir is very different than what I tried on at the shop. They feel narrow just behind arch of my foot. Basically they are un wearable
review.name: Strange fit
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody: 2 things I need in a hiking shoe. Good fit for my wide feet , which I usually don’t find in Solomon  and Traction for hiking in Red Rick Country. This shoe has both
review.name: Great fit

review.reviewBody: Good shoe. I wear a 10.5, but I wear a 10 in Salamon. Good fit. Very light. Versatile.
review.name: Thundercross

review.reviewBody: A good looking very comfortable shoe to wear. Fit is true to size. Very light. Fairly aggressive tread. Arch support and cushioning are good.  Would give  5 stars but I have not had them long enough to assess durability.
review.name: A very good trail shoe

review.reviewBody: This is my third pair of shoes with the same tread. It is comfortable and really good on the trails and hills. Once they start to wear out I use them for cutting grass. I have a hill in my yard and even when the soles are worn they still grip very well.
review.name: Great trail / grass shoe

review.reviewBody: I bought my Salomon Thurdercross shoes a month ago, then I tested them in the muddy and stoney, Surrey Hills. Just when I was hoping I could slow down (even more) because I had no grip, the shoes gripped again and held fast, meaning I had to keep going! These shoes must have been designed to emulate limpets because they seem stick to every possible surface. Chapeau!
review.name: An Excellent Purchase

name: Thundercross Trail Running Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Really tried to like this shoe. I've had a pair or two previously of this shoe and came back for more but this version is... mediocre. This Gore version runs narrower and a bit shorter than the non-Gore and they are too firm and tiring underfoot. I also wear various road and trail runners from Salomon and these are in comparison narrower. Just to "synthetic" and stiff feeling. The upper part of the tongue needs help as well, to much "stuff" sticking out that doesn't get tucked in when lacing the shoe which makes for more debris getting into shoe. Tongue could be more like the XT-6. Just my opinion, but putting these to the back of the closet.
review.name: Meh.

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great purchase 👍 been wearing these shoes daily since they arrived. Look sharp keeps my feet warm and dry in snow, slush I’m sure rain as well. The quick zip lace system was new to me but love the ease of quickly sinching them down and ready to go. Would recommend to others and buy again.
review.name: Favorite winter shoes ever

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I like these shoes for hiking in difficult terrain, its gtx is useful in case of rainy weather, the stability on rocky road is perfect for me, I use these shoes for mid-mountain up to 5000 meters above sea level with no problem, even in snow, the shoes are still very comfortable in long distances up to 11hrs i have done.
review.name: Love these shoes

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have been wearing this model of shoe for decades...absolutely wonderful....waterproof, comfortable and durable.
review.name: Great Shoes

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Nice comfortable shoes fit well for my 14 narrow feet
review.name: Good fit

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Got them today, tried them on. Size 11.5. The soles are painfully uncomfortable.
review.name: Look great - but extremely uncomfortable

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: The X Ultra 4GTX has never disappointed. I’ve had several pairs, low and mid. Hiking is a regular activity for me. The gore Tex seal keeps the water out, great support in the shoe and your foot is well protected from roots, toe stubs and rocks. I’ve found the traction to be excellent. The shoe is a bit narrow which is something to be aware of. I have a narrow foot and a high arch and the fit works very well for me. I’ve come to like the speed lacing after not being sure about it. After a hike it is great to release the speed lace toggle but still be able to walk efficiently with the loosened shoes without laces in the way and the shoe being too loose. Please keep this style in place as it is!
review.name: Great shoe!

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have tried just about every hiking boot/trail shoe on the market.  And they all end up in the trash. I've wasted thousands of dollars on all the gimmicks. Solomon is the first and only footwear that requires no break-in period.  I have never had a blister or any foot problems in their shoes.  I cannot say anywhere near the same about their competitors.  I hiked 15 miles out of the box with both my pairs of Solomons and absolutely no problems!  Thank you Solomon for doing what your competitors are unable to do and deliver on, Quality, Wearability, Durability and Comfort.
review.name: The Best Hiking Footwear of all Time!

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great quality exactly what I needed. Good looking shoe and light
review.name: Great

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
these are my 3rd pair.
the only issue I have with them is that the sole detaches from the uppers after time
review.name: comfy but longevity issues

name: X Ultra 4 GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: This is a great backpack for work trips and general travel. It has good capacity and quite a comfortable harness system, but it absolutely needs a hipbelt at 40L. The addition of a stowable or removable padded hipbelt would easily take this to 5 stars
review.name: NEEDS a good hipbelt

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I removed this backpack complimentary from influenster. Pros: the material is lightweight, feels durable and excellent quality. There are lots of pockets and compartments for organizing. It holds a lot of stuff. Cons: it's a large shape & size that's awkward to wear on a person who isn't very tall. It wouldn't work easily on public transit but would be fine for air travel.
review.name: Lightweight material with plenty of room but awkward large size

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] While larger than I was initially anticipating, this bag is perfect for one-baggers.  I travel often for work and tested the Subterra 2 by transferring the entire contents from my carryon roller suitcase.  Everything fit perfectly and the soft sides allowed for it to be compressed a bit more easily in the overhead compartment of the plane.  It is a bit bulky as a backpack, but I would easily be able to fit 2 weeks worth of travel gear so worth it to me.
review.name: Perfect for one-bag travel

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a FANTASTIC Carry On! This is way bigger inside than I ever thought possible. Not to mention, the Laptop Pouch and carrier is a lifesaver! I love that you can carry it on your shoulders like a backpack or carry it like a duffle bag! This is perfect for someone constantly on the go!
review.name: This is FANTASTIC

name: Subterra 2 Convertible Carry-On Bag

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Chelsea WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I really wanted to love these. Bought these to wear in the winter months to walk my dog, but also to wear when running errands. Fit was good, toe box was perfect and I loved how secure I felt walking in them.
I wore them to my mailbox and the elastic was so tight & scratchy it irritated my ankle and calf and left an abrasion. Also, the area where the elastic meets the leather seem rubbed against my ankles to the point it was painful with low cut socks. Wore taller socks and it was better, but I wanted to slip these on with or without socks. 
Wanted to love these but returned and will look for a pair without the scratchy elastic.
review.name: Really wanted to love these

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Chelsea WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Comfortable right out of the box and cute. The toe is a bit more rounded and wide then I expected so they don’t read quite as dressy as I had hoped but the comfort makes up for it.
review.name: Comfy and cute

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Chelsea WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These were an early Holiday gift for my daughter for Christmas. She's had a chance to wear them and says they are great. She uses them to trek out and walk her pup. Staying both stylish and functional these boots really worked for her. I don't have all the fitting details but I know she wanted a larger toe box.
review.name: Nice boots!

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Chelsea WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Looks even better in IRL. Needed to exchange tough because the run small!
review.name: Looks great, feels great - but needed to size up!

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Chelsea WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Don’t listen to the reviews saying to size up! I did and I wish I hadn’t. Just order your normal size. But I do wear small inserts.The shoes are very cute and just as described. It took forever to find a chunky boot I liked enough to buy and I receive compliments on them
review.name: They’re great don’t listen to the other reviews

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Chelsea WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These are very cute and practical. I would recommend wearing them in before walking a long distance in them. I wore mine for the first time for a 2 mile walk. My feet were killing me and I had huge blisters. They are narrow so I would size up if you have normal to wide feet or look for a different boot.
review.name: Cute and practical

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Chelsea WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I loved this shoe but literally could not get my foot in it- it took me 5 minutes to put on one shoe and could not get on the second shoe.  Once on it felt good and looked super cute but I have to send back since I could not get the second one on.
review.name: Loved but could not get my foot in the boot
comment: Oh no! We'd love to hear more about your thoughts on our shoes. Please contact our Customer Care team so we can get to the bottom of what wasn't so great about your experience.

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Chelsea WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: They are so comfortable. I want to wear every day.
review.name: Great pair of boots

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Chelsea WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Great fit! I think these boots are so comfortable and I have been wearing them daily for the past week. They are completely waterproof as advertised and fit like a glove. I will say I wish the style was slightly more sleek/dressy but I also think that is hard to find with waterproof shoes. However, overall I am obsessed and glad I ordered even though I have wide feet as I didn't find that they are narrow at all. Just a heads up, the shoe insert almost blends in when you buy so make sure to take that out and they'll be perfect!
review.name: Exceptionally comfy!

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Chelsea WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I LOVE THESE boots!  I was a little nervous that the soles would be clunky but they are soooo comfy and also stylish!
review.name: New Favorite Boot!

name: Ona Ave Chelsea WP Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: My daughter outgrew the Prospect Jr and I switched her to the Scout Jr in a medium. In one day of skiing, a piece of Velcro ate through half the very soft chin strap and I see now that the strap on the Prospect Jr is sturdier.
review.name: Soft helmet strap

review.reviewBody: My 6yo LOVES his new helmet! Keeps his ears warm, fits his head w/o wobbling around, and it looks dope w/ his new goggles!
review.name: LOVE IT!

review.reviewBody: Great style and fit. Adjustment is a little more complicated then other helmets. Vents don’t open and close. Huge fan of smith though as a life long customer. Have great support!
review.name: Great style and fit. Adjustment

review.reviewBody: Smith is the only brand of helmet, sunglasses and goggles I will wear. Always the best!
review.name: Smith is the best

review.reviewBody: A great fit for my seven year old while being adjustable to grow with him. The helmet keeps his head warm on cold days in the Canadian Rockies. The style is great - looks like an adult helmet.
review.name: A great fit for my

review.reviewBody: Great fit great quality only goggles I’ll spend my hard earned money on
review.name: Great fit great quality only

review.reviewBody: The Scout Jr. has the same online measurements as the Scout (same diameter), but is much more shallow- doesn't come down far enough for my teen. I wish this was mentioned- now I'm stuck with a gaper lid.
review.name: Not enough sizing info

review.reviewBody: True to size. Excellent quality! Gives a strong piece of mind that safety is not compromised and my son is safe.
review.name: True to size. Excellent quality!

review.reviewBody:
I got this helmet for my 7 year old. He is comfortable, looks good and I like that it comes with MIPS. Thanks Smith! 

My 9 year old also wears the scout jr, medium.
review.name: Great Helmet

review.reviewBody: The helmet looks great (good style/matte black color) and the quality is what we’ve come to expect from Smith! MIPS is important, as any added protection for my boy is appreciated. Although there is no Boa system, the flex fit system keeps the helmet in place very well. Works well so far!
review.name: Love bug’s Dad

name: Scout Jr Mips Helmet - Kids'

description: Buy the Columbia Forbidden Peak Interchange Jacket - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Forbidden Peak Interchange Jacket - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Columbia Forbidden Peak Interchange Jacket - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Ordered the Forbidden Peak Jacket in a large based on the sizing information on the website in addition to already having the 3 Columbia Jackets in size large that fit well.  Not only was the jacket too big on me, it actually fit my husband who typically wears a men's size large.  Please adjust your size measurements online to match the product!
review.name: Runs very large

review.reviewBody: It keeps me warm :) I only recently started using this. However, I was wearing it at 0 deg temperature, and it was so warm. I thought maybe my weather app was not updated. I removed my jacket, and it was cold outside, but I didn't feel cold at all!
review.name: Does what it says :D nice and warm.

review.reviewBody:
I bought this for an upcoming winter camping trip with a scouting troop. I had bought an XS Whirlibird IV to match my daughters which ran small so I ordered this as a replacement. Since the other ran small, I ordered the Forbidden Peak in a Small. It's pretty huge. The width of the arms fits but the sleeves, lining with extendable cuff with thumb loop and the length were way too long. My fingertips came to a 1/2" shy of the end of the sleeve/cuff. Hopefully an XS will fit better. It'd be great if Columbia was more consistent in their sizing. 

The Pros: ALL of it! The Omni-Heat reflective interior does its job like nothing else on the market. The arm holes provide excellent ventilation when needed. The pockets are uber deep and plentiful.
review.name: Excellent features but runs large

name: Forbidden Peak Interchange Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: Boxers fit very well in size medium.  I wear large in boxer briefs.
review.name: Fit & Size

review.reviewBody: A functional piece of kit for everyday adventures.
review.name: My Undies

review.reviewBody: Exofficio 2.0 are the most comfortable underwear I have worn. Especially if you like being outdoors or traveling.The quick drying and easy cleaning make these underwear the perfect match. The 2.0 versions are definitely softer and fit to size is correct.if you want a great pair of underwear that will last and is durable this is your brand!!
review.name: Only way to Give-N-Go outdoors

review.reviewBody: I have a set of Exofficio boxer briefs that I purchased years ago and use all the time while hiking.  For my everyday I enjoy wearing boxers instead and figured these would be a great option.  I have been wearing them now for 4 months and have gotten to the point where I avoid wearing them whenever I can.  They do not fit at all like boxers, they fit more like boxer briefs, and they constantly get bunched up.  The material itself is really nice but I am very disappointed in the overall fit of the boxers.
review.name: Regret this purchase
comment:
Hello,


Thank you for providing feedback on our Men's Give-N-Go® 2.0 Boxer. We really appreciate you bringing this to our attention.

I am very sorry to hear that the item did not meet your expectations in terms of fit.

We will make sure to forward your feedback to the appropriate department so that we can consider an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you for sharing your opinion with us.

We are here to help you resolve any issues you may have with any of our products. If you need further assistance, please don't hesitate to contact us at https://www.exofficio.com/support/contact-us or via LiveChat. We're available Mon. 9AM-5PM EST.

Thank you!
ExOfficio Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: They last a long time. I like boxers now-a-days. They feel good against the skin. I should have bought a size smaller but it’s not that big a deal. My others have been through a lot and are still in good shape. They’re the the only underwear I wear now.
review.name: Excellent Fit and Feel

review.reviewBody: Comfortable and light weight. Drap nicely. Fit like regular cotton boxers, but fell soft on the skin. Hang try quickly. Good for everyday or travel.
review.name: Men's Give-N-Go 2.0 Boxer's

review.reviewBody: Perfect for travel and everyday use.  Packs small but is still strong enough to use while at home.
review.name: Recommend strongly

review.reviewBody: Second or third time purchasing. Like them very much
review.name: Not applicable

review.reviewBody: I've worn different versions of the Give-N-Go for at least years. I travel a lot and appreciate the quick drying properties. I live in the desert and can attest that these are the best at keeping you dry on hot days. This most recent version seems as nice as the previous. Much better than any other comparable product that I can find on the market.
review.name: A fantastic boxer

review.reviewBody: These boxers are super lightweight and very comfortable. They fit great. Could be a bit shorter but definitely not a big deal.
review.name: Lightweight and comfortable

name: Give-N-Go 2.0 Boxer - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Reactor Extreme Mummy + Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] When temps get low, this liner is great to take the edge off of the cold air. Comfortable fabric. I am pleased with the results. Partner to a zero degree bag, it is exactly what I was looking for
review.name: When temps get low, this

review.itemreviewed: Reactor Extreme Mummy + Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This liner is always with me, if I am not using to stay extra toasty in my bag, I use it as a pad sheet for sleeping on during the hot desert nights. Absolute must have for any serious outdoors person
review.name: Perfect Liner!

review.itemreviewed: Reactor Extreme Mummy + Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Just went on a 3 days camping trip using my traverse IIv -4 sleeping bag and this liner inside. I am always cold, but this liner really warmed up the bag and made it toasty. Waking up to -3 celsius in the morning, I didn't want to get up because it was so nice inside my bag, liner and tent. 
For me, I will get down booties though as my feet are never warm. 
Highly recommended and it is light and packs small.
review.name: reactor extreme really warms up the sleeping bag.

review.itemreviewed: Reactor Extreme Mummy + Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Light weight and amazing warmth. I ordered this to add the additional warmth and my bag and it has exceeded my expectations!
review.name: The perfect addition to my gear!

review.itemreviewed: Reactor Extreme Mummy + Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Reactor sleeping bag liners are a must have, not only to protect the sleeping bag but to give added comfort and warmth. The reactor extreme really delivers and its design features, with the arm holes and base draw cord, make it functionally versatile and adaptable over a range of temperatures.
review.name: Enhance your sleeping system

review.itemreviewed: Reactor Extreme Mummy + Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Staying toasty on cold nights is critical for a good night sleep for me. The opening at the bottom allows me to have my feet out and still benefit from the extra warmth.
review.name: Toasty and feet accessible

review.itemreviewed: Reactor Extreme Mummy + Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The insulation on this is top tier, this will definitely work when we go camping “off season”. It packs back up easily, and doesn’t take up a lot of room. It’s soft, and large enough to fit my brother in law who is 6’3 comfortably.
review.name: Perfect for “backcountry” campers!!

review.itemreviewed: Reactor Extreme Mummy + Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got this complimentary from influenster and seatosummit for my honest review. I love the vibrant color. It easily slips into another bag and it keeps you toasty warm. It's beautifully made and nice quality.
review.name: Toasty

review.itemreviewed: Reactor Extreme Mummy + Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This liner is so easy and light weight to carry around. My husband takes this out to the field for work for months. He said it works amazing it the heat and in the cold. So this is a definitely ￼
review.name: Great

review.itemreviewed: Reactor Extreme Mummy + Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love that it’s easy to pack, light and super warm. The texture is super soft too. Highly recommend as an extra layer for your sleeping bag! Perfect for super cold camping nights.
review.name: Great Warm Liner

name: Reactor Extreme Mummy + Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner

review.reviewBody: Heavy-duty outer mitt, warm removable liner combine to make this your go-to mitten. Whether its a bluebird day on the slopes or your are pushing for the summit, this is the mitt for you.
review.name: The warmest mitt EVER!

review.reviewBody: My wife recently got the Alti Mitts, she gets cold hands skiing in the Northeast. We were out a couple of weeks ago and she was toasty warm skiing all day. Thanks for such a great product, we have wasted so much money on what companies have called their warmest, they failed us, you didn't.
review.name: Finally, really warm hands!

review.reviewBody: The mitts keep my hands and fingers WARM, huge success to finally find a pair that works in the cold temperatures. They are long, go over my jacket sleeves and keep the snow from getting inside. The liners stay in place, attached by Velcro without any interference. I give the 4 star when I use them while skiing because of the inability to grip objects, like ski poles. I have used them four times so far and hope they soften a bit more with use. They are great for walks and hikes.
review.name: Warm hands

review.reviewBody: Using the size chart I ordered these in a Women's L/8 but they were still a bit too short for my long fingers.  They seemed like they would have been nice and warm if a bit bulky.  I would have ordered the next size up (a Mens L/9) but I came across the OR Mt Baker II mitts with glove liners and ordered those to try instead, mostly because they have a wrist tightening strap that I would like to have.
review.name: Returned, too small.

review.reviewBody: I have Raynaud's disease and have tried ever kind of mitts sold. I have spent up to $600 on a pair and they did not compare or even come close to the warmth of these. I have always had to add hand warmer packets to my mitts no matter who made them except for these ones. I am not even ordering a case of hand warmer packets like I do every year as I do not need them for these mitts. I had the best test with them this weekend -30 with wind chill and my hands were toasty for the first time ever! Thank you Outdoor Research for making these. I get no bonuses absolutely nothing for saying any of this other than I want the world to know, as I know what the struggle is like finding mitts that work. If I could give them 1000 ⭐️'S I would. I work with a lot of clients and normally I am not the person to endorse anything but these I can't be quiet about them.
review.name: The best ever!!!!!!!!!

name: Alti II GORE-TEX Mitten- Women's

review.reviewBody: These seated up nice and easy with a floor pump, and the 120 TPI feels great on the trail. Traction is okay, I was expecting more with how much siping these have. My biggest complaint is that the 2.35 is insanely narrow! It set up more like a 2.2 on my 26mm ID rims. Maybe the 4C compound has more grip?
review.name: Super narrow

review.itemreviewed: Bare Steps H20 Shoe - Toddler Girls'
review.reviewBody: Fit babies extra wide feet, easy to get on and off. Very lightweight and he’s had no problem adapting to walking in them. Need to figure out how to clean them because they have gotten pretty smelly already.
review.name: Great!

review.itemreviewed: Bare Steps H20 Shoe - Toddler Girls'
review.reviewBody: Great shoe for my toddler’s foot. Wide or Medium available and both work ok for my kid. Breathable and durable.
review.name: Lovely shoe for chubby toddler feet.

review.itemreviewed: Bare Steps H20 Shoe - Toddler Girls'
review.reviewBody: Comfy, easy to put on, can be worn as every day sneakers. Our size was sold out, but I was so happy to find second hand pair. My toddler has been wearing them every day to bike and walk. Never got to wear them as water shoes. Nice cooler shoe option for hot days.
review.name: All purpose shoes

review.itemreviewed: Bare Steps H20 Shoe - Toddler Girls'
review.reviewBody: These shoes are wonderful. Easy for my kids to get on and off themselves which is a huge plus! I keep buying the next size up for them!
review.name: Great for independent children
comment: Thanks for sharing your great experience with us!

review.itemreviewed: Bare Steps H20 Shoe - Toddler Girls'
review.reviewBody: Great shoe for a toddler, my favourite so far. It’s wide enough for their little chubby feet, super comfy and light. I wanted something without a foam platform for the most natural feel shoe, and this one is great and flexible. Love
review.name: My favourite so far.

review.itemreviewed: Bare Steps H20 Shoe - Toddler Girls'
review.reviewBody: These shoes have been great for my 18-mo old's feet! Love the width and how they allow his feet to really explore while still being protected. They're also great in the water and he can go seamlessly between splashing in a creek back to the land!
review.name: Excellent barefoot feeling

review.itemreviewed: Bare Steps H20 Shoe - Toddler Girls'
review.reviewBody: Being a Merrell fan I’d love to buy these but it seems like you don’t sell them in Europe/Sweden. Why? 😢

review.itemreviewed: Bare Steps H20 Shoe - Toddler Girls'
review.reviewBody: This is the perfect summer water shoe for little feet!  We took ours to the Saco River in New Hamphire that’s full of slippery rocks and sand and his footing was great!   They have excellent traction and dried overnights!
review.name: Perfect for River adventures!
